Appointed the Episcopal bishop of Atlanta in the year 2000, Trache had to withdraw when his superiors learned he had recently been “overwhelmed with the worldly affairs of personal finance” 17and forced to file for bankruptcy. This case, Manning tells us, belies the stereotype of the irresponsible, spiritually adrift credit card abuser.

曼宁向读者保证，信用卡的流行是如此剧烈，甚至连 “受精神指引的人” 都无法幸免。16为了证明他的观点，他引用了一位罗伯特·特拉切牧师的案例。2000 年，特拉奇被任命为亚特兰大圣公会主教，当他的上级得知他最近被 “个人财务的世俗事务压得喘不过气来” 17并被迫申请破产时，不得不撤回。曼宁告诉我们，这个案例掩盖了人们对不负责任、精神上漂泊的信用卡滥用者的刻板印象。

Trache, however, tells a different story. In a recent interview, he claims that he “had to withdraw because my marriage was in trouble,” adding, “I’m on my second marriage now.” 18Not exactly old school, he says that the two historical people he would most like to meet are Henry VIII and Mary Magdalene — “I believe Jesus learned a lot from her” —— and the purpose of religion is to “discover the interconnectedness between people and the universe.” 19Trache may belie some stereotypes, but that of spiritually grounded Christian is not one of them.

然而，特拉奇讲述了一个不同的故事。在最近的一次采访中，他声称，他 “不得不退出，因为我的婚姻出现了问题”，他补充说，“我现在是第二次婚姻。” 18并不完全是老派，他说他最想见到的两个历史人物是亨利八世和抹大拉的玛丽 —— “我相信耶稣从她那里学到了很多” —— 而宗教的目的是 “发现人与宇宙之间相互联系的东西”。19特拉奇可能相信一些刻板印象，但以精神为基础的基督徒并不是其中之一。

Manning concedes there are consumers “on the Puritan side of the moral divide.” 20These people adhere to a traditional ethic, reject the seductions of the banks, and pay their credit card bills at the end of each month. Manning has mixed feelings about this lot. After a grudging bit of left-handed praise, he scolds them for “tak[ing] advantage of the punitive social underpinnings of the moral divide as convenience users.” 21To reinforce his point, he adds that bankers “disdainfully” refer to such people as “deadbeats.” In the real world, a more accurate adverb would beironically.

曼宁承认有一些消费者 “在道德鸿沟的清教徒一边”。20这些人坚持传统伦理，拒绝银行的诱惑，并在每个月底支付信用卡账单。曼宁对这批人的感受很复杂。在一番勉强的左手赞美之后，他斥责他们 “利用了道德鸿沟的惩罚性社会基础，成为便利的使用者”。21为了加强他的观点，他补充说，银行家 “不屑地” 将这些人称为 “无赖”。在现实世界中，更准确的副词应该是 “讽刺地”。

In researching his book and documentary of the same name ——Maxed Out—— James Scurlock made a pilgrimage to Manning’s office at the Rochester Institute of Technology. Although Scurlock has a redeeming sense of humor and a bit more detachment, he largely accepts Manning’s contention that the financial industry is to blame for the indebtedness of so many Americans and the death of the Puritan ethic.

在研究他的书和同名纪录片时 —— Maxed Out —— 詹姆斯·斯库尔洛克（James Scurlock）曾到曼宁在罗切斯特理工学院的办公室朝圣。虽然斯库尔洛克有一种令人欣慰的幽默感和更多的疏离感，但他基本上接受了曼宁的论点，即金融业应该为这么多美国人的负债和清教徒伦理的死亡负责。

In the same paragraph that Scurlock chides Citibank’s Walter Wriston for his “disregard of history,” he celebrates those “stodgy old bankers whose fathers and grandfathers had warned them about the need for regulation — the ones who were quite comfortable operating the small banks in the small towns and granting credit to individuals only with great caution.” 22

斯库尔洛克责备花旗银行的沃尔特·赖斯顿（Walter Wriston ）“无视历史” 的同一段中，他赞美那些 “古板的老银行家，他们的父辈曾警告他们需要监管 —— 那些在小城镇经营小银行并只在非常谨慎的情况下向个人发放信贷的人相当舒服。” 22

In truth, bankers have always resented regulation except, as is only natural, when it benefits them. It was the small-town bankers, after all, who pushed for unit-banking legislation to protect their local monopolies. Unfortunately, the legislation left them without diversified resources when the Depression hit, and they failed in great numbers. In truth, too, customers have always resented bankers who would deny them their dreams. Has there been a bank lobby scene in any movie in which the naysaying banker is portrayed as something other than a judgmental prig?

事实上，银行家们一直都很反感监管，除非是对他们有利的时候，这也是很自然的。毕竟，是小镇的银行家们推动了单位银行业务的立法，以保护他们在当地的垄断地位。不幸的是，当大萧条来临时，该立法使他们没有多样化的资源，他们大量地失败。事实上，客户也一直憎恨那些拒绝他们梦想的银行家。在任何一部电影中，是否有一个银行大堂的场景，将持反对意见的银行家描绘成一个评头论足的假小子？

Like Manning, Scurlock celebrates a history that did not exist. Like Manning, too, he singles out financial freedom as the one freedom that should be denied Americans, especially American youth. Bizarrely, the same people who insist that adolescents should be able to drive, drink, cohabit, vote, and get an abortion without their parent’s consent are horrified when a bank sends these kids a credit card application.

和曼宁一样，斯库尔洛克庆祝了一段不存在的历史。和曼宁一样，他也把财务自由作为美国人，特别是美国年轻人应该被剥夺的自由。奇怪的是，那些坚持认为青少年应该可以开车、喝酒、同居、投票和不经父母同意而堕胎的人，在银行向这些孩子发送信用卡申请时却感到惊恐。

Among the stories that Scurlock tells, all of which hold to the social puritans template, is that of Elizabeth Warren, a professor at Harvard Law and a crusader for bankruptcy rights. In the late 1990s she had been tasked with discovering why so many Americans were going bankrupt during a time of seeming prosperity. She had presumed the answer would be too many people spending irresponsibly for too many unnecessary goods.

在斯库尔洛克讲述的故事中，所有这些故事都坚持社会清教徒的模板，其中包括伊丽莎白·沃伦的故事，她是哈佛大学法学院的教授，也是破产权利的十字军。在二十世纪 90 年代末，她的任务是发现为什么在一个看似繁荣的时期有这么多美国人要破产。她推测答案是有太多的人不负责任地花钱购买太多不必要的商品。

What she found was “shocking,” at least to Scurlock. “The most reliable predictor of whether someone would declare bankruptcy,” he continues, “wasn’t the number of credit cards or the pairs of shoes in the closet, it was whether or not they were females. And then whether or not that woman had a child.” 23

她的发现是 “令人震惊的”，至少对斯库尔洛克来说是如此。他继续说 ：“预测一个人是否会宣布破产的最可靠因素，不是信用卡的数量或衣柜里的鞋子，而是他们是否是女性。然后是这个女人是否有孩子。” 23

A traditionalist would be inclined to address the underlying problem: women, often with children, making their way through life without husbands and the financial protection they provide. For the social puritans, the phenomenon of single women with children is not inherently a problem. The problem is that greedy bankers seduce these women with easy credit, and then mean-spirited public officials deny them easy bankruptcy. In pitch-perfect social puritan patois, Scurlock lays the problem off on a capitalism that “worked for a long time but that has been released from its tethers and has mutated into a relentlessly efficient and voracious machine.” 24

一个传统主义者会倾向于解决潜在的问题：妇女，通常带着孩子，在没有丈夫和他们提供的经济保护的情况下闯荡生活。对于社会清教徒来说，有孩子的单身妇女现象本身并不是一个问题。问题在于，贪婪的银行家用容易的信贷来诱惑这些妇女，而后由吝啬的政府官员拒绝让她们轻易破产。用完美的社会清教徒的口吻，斯库尔洛克把问题归咎于资本主义，“长期以来一直在运作，但已经从其束缚中解脱出来，并变异为一个无情的高效和贪婪的机器。” 24

A traditionalist like Michael Novak would counter that democratic capitalism works best when all of its agents assume responsibility. “How can a people govern a whole society,” he asks, “that cannot, each of them, govern themselves?” 25

像迈克尔·诺瓦克这样的传统主义者会反驳说，“当民主资本主义的所有代理人都承担起责任时，它的效果最好。” 他问道 ：“一个民族怎么能治理整个社会呢？” 25

twenty-sixThe Greed Decade 贪婪的十年

THE SO-CALLED GRGREED DECADE FULFILLED ITS CINEMATIC POTENTIAL on the evening of September 15, 1986. The setting was the bar mitzvah of the thirteen-year-old son of real estate developer Gerald Guterman.1The lad was named Jason, as was every other thirteen-year-old in America in 1986. Guterman was also celebrating, however belatedly, the bat mitzvahs of his two daughters by a previous marriage — and in 1986 who did not have at least one previous marriage?

所谓的 “贪婪的十年” 在 1986 年 9 月 15 日的晚上发挥了它的电影潜力。1这个小伙子名叫杰森，和 1986 年美国其他 13 岁的孩子一样。古特曼也在庆祝他的两个前妻女儿的成年礼，不过是迟到了；而在 1986 年，谁没有至少一个前妻呢？

This was not your grandfather’s bar mitzvah. As befitted a decade of excess, Guterman had rented the QE2 and its thousand-person crew at a price approaching one million dollars for an overnight, forty-six–mile “cruise to nowhere.” This price did not include the hiring of the Peter Duchin orchestra or the services of Stu Feinstein, one of America’s premier party planners. Feinstein, in fact, still ranks this event number one among the top ten events he has ever planned.

这不是你祖父的成人礼。与十年来的过度行为相称，古特曼以接近一百万美元的价格租下了 QE2 和它的一千名船员，进行了一夜的、46 英里的 “不归路” 巡游。这个价格不包括雇用彼得·杜钦的管弦乐队和美国最重要的派对策划人之一斯图·范斯坦的服务。事实上，范斯坦仍将这次活动列为他所策划的十大活动之一。

“The Guterman’s [sic] had simply instructed me to create unique surprises and total fun,” he notes on his Web site. “I armed myself with a 40+ member ensemble from Le Clique, 200 costumes and props and total artistic freedom. Our goal was to help convert this excursion into a fantasy voyage of epic proportions. We had a ball!” 2To pull this off, Feinstein had to corner New York’s entire mime market for the weekend, a break for the city at large.

“古特曼夫妇只是指示我创造独特的惊喜和完全的乐趣”，他在其网站上指出。“我用来自 Le Clique 的 40 多名成员的合奏、200 套服装和道具以及完全的艺术自由武装自己。我们的目标是帮助把这次旅行变成一次史诗般的奇幻之旅。我们玩得很开心！” 2为了完成这个任务，范斯坦必须在周末占领纽约的整个哑剧市场，这是整个城市的小憩之地。

At the actual ceremony, the hired rabbi sang the praises of Jason’s parents. “In a home that has everything,” he said, “Linda and Gerry also stress to their children that which gives us purpose.” 3Given the circumstances, the guests had to wonder what the “that” could possibly have been. They were not likely to learn from the evening’s most special guest. Having intentionally missed the launch, he descended onto the ship in a twin-engine helicopter and stepped out in black tie and tails to a swell of laughter and applause. Ace arbitrageur Ivan Boesky had arrived.

在实际的仪式上，受雇的拉比为杰森的父母唱了赞歌。“在一个什么都有的家里”，他说，“琳达和格里还向他们的孩子强调，这让我们有了目标。” 3鉴于这种情况，客人不得不怀疑 “那个” 有可能是什么。他们不可能从当晚最特别的客人那里得知。他故意错过了发布会，乘着一架双引擎直升机降落在船上，身着黑色领带和燕尾服，在一片笑声和掌声中走了出来。王牌套利者伊万·博伊斯基（Ivan Boesky）已经抵达。

“Don’t ever use my helicopter again for a stunt like this,” a friend scolded Boesky after the fact. “Revolutions are made of this. People get put in gas ovens.” 4The friend would have been even more disturbed had he known that the day after the ship docked, Boesky would surrender to federal authorities for his role in a massive insider-trading scheme.

“不要再用我的直升机做这样的特技”，一位朋友事后责备博伊斯基。"革命就是这样发生的…… 因为人们被关进了毒气炉。” 4如果这位朋友知道在船靠岸的第二天，博伊斯基将向联邦当局自首，因为他在一个大规模内幕交易计划中扮演的角色，他会更加不安的。

What speaks well of late-century America is that Boesky, Jewish as he was, paranoid as he was, never had to fear an anti-Semitic backlash, let alone gas ovens. Neither did his coconspirators, especially the prominent ones like Martin Siegel, Dennis Levine, and Michael Milken. Although all of the major players, as well as many of the minor ones, were of Jewish descent, in the Gentile imagination the greed decade had no particular ethnic connotation. At the time, Jewish religious leaders worried that it might. Prominent rabbi David Gordis feared that Boesky and pals would evoke ancient stereotypes of Jews as “exploiters of the economy, parasites, profiteers.” 5

对世纪末的美国来说，最能说明问题的是，博伊斯基，尽管他是犹太人，尽管他是个偏执狂，但他从未担心过反犹主义的反弹，更不用说毒气炉了。他的同谋者也没有，特别是像马丁·西格尔、丹尼斯·莱文和迈克尔·米尔肯这样著名的人。虽然所有的主要参与者以及许多次要参与者都是犹太后裔，但在外邦人的想象中，贪婪的十年并没有特别的民族内涵。当时，犹太宗教领袖担心它可能。知名拉比大卫·戈迪斯（David Gordis）担心，博斯基和伙伴们会唤起对犹太人 “经济剥削者、寄生虫、暴发户” 的古老成见。 5

At a panel on ethics in April 1987, Gordis insisted that lessons be learned from the scandals. “As a people,” he implored, “we must look more deeply into the recesses of our tradition, our experience, and our values. The prophets and sages of Jewish history preached and taught a doctrine of justice, honesty, and social responsibility.” 6Influential socialist Michael Harrington sat on that same 1987 panel. To no one’s great surprise, he attributed the scandals to “a larger ethos of egotism and greed promoted under the Reagan presidency.” 7A lazy and partisan media preferred Harrington’s spin to Gordis’s introspection.

在 1987 年 4 月的一个道德专题讨论会上，戈尔迪斯（Gordis）坚持认为应该从这些丑闻中吸取教训。“作为一个民族”，他恳求道，“我们必须更深入地研究我们的传统、我们的经验和我们的价值观的深处。犹太历史上的先知和圣人宣扬和教导正义、诚实和社会责任的学说。” 6有影响力的社会主义者迈克尔·哈林顿（Michael Harrington）也坐在 1987 年的小组中。没有人感到惊讶，他将这些丑闻归咎于 “里根总统任期内提倡的更大的利己主义和贪婪精神”。7懒惰和党派的媒体更喜欢哈林顿的旋转而不是戈尔迪斯的反省。

A quick Google search for “greed Reagan” produces nearly eight million hits, many of them seething. The first listing on this particular day reads, “Purveyor of greed, Reagan: his body should have been left in the street for the dogs.” The second one is less charitable still: “I would have to agree with the characterization of the 1980’s being a decade of ‘greed’ because Reagan was president, a g****, f***ing conservative who . . .” The postings do not get much kinder.

在谷歌上快速搜索 “贪婪的里根”，产生了近 800 万个点击，其中许多是愤怒的。在这个特殊的日子里，第一条信息是 ：“贪婪的传播者里根：他的尸体应该被扔在街上给狗吃。” 第二条则不那么友好 ：“我不得不同意 80 年代是一个‘贪婪的十年’的说法，因为里根是总统，一个贪婪操蛋的保守派，他…… ” 帖子中没有更多的善意。

Given the rage about greed, stoked anew in the last few years, the nation has done well to avoid an ethnic identification. Our sensitivities, however, have precluded us from any kind of meaningful cultural analysis, either of greed in general or the eighties in particular. Those who have looked cursorily at the decade, and have transcended the Reagan fixation, might be tempted to think that Wall Street had gotten too Jewish. Those who look deeper might conclude, as Gordis did, that Wall Street was no longer Jewish enough.

鉴于过去几年重新激起的对贪婪的愤怒，国家已经很好地避免了种族识别。然而，我们的敏感性使我们无法进行任何有意义的文化分析，无论是对一般的贪婪还是对八十年代的贪婪。那些粗略地看了一下这十年，并超越了对里根的迷恋的人，可能会认为华尔街变得太犹太化。那些看得更深的人可能会像戈尔迪斯那样得出结论，华尔街不再是足够的犹太人。

“I want to be a latter day Rothschild,” 8Boesky had boasted in 1985, a year before his downfall. He had gone so far as to buy into a savings-and-loan to establish a base for his rise as merchant banker in the Rothschild mold. What Boesky failed to understand is that even if they’d had helicopters in the nine­teenth century, the Rothschilds would never have made a flashy landing at a seagoing bar mitzvah. Their enduring success hinged on discretion, restraint, tradition, family, faith. Boesky had none of this. He was only as interested in Judaism as his investors were.9

“我想成为后世的罗斯柴尔德”，8博斯基在 1985 年，在他倒台前一年曾吹嘘过。他甚至还买下了一家储蓄贷款公司，为自己成为罗斯柴尔德模式的商业银行家奠定了基础。博斯基不明白的是，即使他们在九至十世纪有直升机，罗斯柴尔德家族也不会在海上的成人礼上华丽地降落。他们持久的成功取决于谨慎、克制、传统、家庭和信仰。博斯基没有这些。9

Born in 1937, Boesky had grown up comfortably in suburban Detroit, but he was definitely not part of Our Crowd. His father, a Russian immigrant, owned a chain of topless bars. When discussing his past, Boesky would refer to them as “delicatessens.” 10He starred at wrestling in high school but little else. After some false starts, he finally graduated from inner-city Mumford High, the school made famous by Eddie Murphy inBeverly Hills Cop. He attended the less-than-prestigious Wayne State, but did not graduate. He did, however, get a law degree from the Detroit College of Law, an institution so fly-by-night it did not require a college diploma for admission. Boesky’s breakthrough came when he married up. Seema Silberstein was the daughter of a wealthy real estate developer. That marriage and Boesky’s scrappy chip-on-your-shoulder ambition would make all the difference.

1937 年出生的博伊斯基在底特律郊区舒适地长大，但他绝对不是我们这群人的一员。他的父亲是一名俄罗斯移民，拥有一家连锁的无上装酒吧。当讨论他的过去时，博斯基会把它们称为 “熟食店”。10他在高中时是摔跤比赛的明星，但其他方面就不怎么样了。经过一些错误的开始，他终于从市中心的芒福德高中毕业，这所学校因埃迪·墨菲的电影《比弗利山超級警探》（Beverly Hills Cop, 1984）而闻名。他后来进入了不太著名的韦恩州立大学，但没有毕业。然而，他确实从底特律法学院获得了一个法律学位，这个机构是如此的不务正业，不需要大学毕业证就可以入学。博斯基的突破是在他结婚的时候。西玛·西伯斯坦（Seema Silberstein）是一位富有的房地产开发商的女儿。这场婚姻和博斯基那份潦倒的、肩上扛着的野心将使一切变得不同。

Culturally, the conspirators had much in common: a grounding in a modest family business, an outsider’s insecurity, and an indifference to the faith and tradition that channeled their ancestors’ ambitions. Authors Ehrlich and Rehfeld would class them among the New Crowd, the brash, energetic, ambitious — sometimes too ambitious — generation of Jewish entrepreneurs on Wall Street who had pushed Our Crowd aside and elbowed their way past their established WASP competitors.11

在文化上，这些阴谋家有很多共同点：立足于谦逊的家族企业，外来者的不安全感，以及对引导他们祖先野心的信仰和传统漠不关心。作者埃利希和雷菲尔德将他们归入 “新人群” 之列，这是华尔街上粗鲁、精力充沛、雄心勃勃 —— 有时过于雄心勃勃 —— 的一代犹太企业家，他们将 “我们的人群” 推到一边，用肘部超越他们既定的‘白鞋’竞争对手。11

Martin Siegel grew up in a Boston suburb with little paternal contact. His father and uncle worked seven days a week struggling to keep their retail shoe business afloat. The eventual collapse of the business would haunt Siegel. A good student, he was the first member of his family to attend college, Rensselaer Polytechnical Institute. After college, he enrolled at Harvard Business School in 1969 and got caught up in the antiwar movement sweeping American campuses.12

马丁·西格尔(Martin Siegel)在波士顿郊区长大，很少与父亲接触。他的父亲和叔叔每周工作七天，努力维持他们的零售鞋业。该业务的最终崩溃将困扰着西格尔。他是个好学生，是家里第一个上大学的人，即伦斯勒理工学院。大学毕业后，他于 1969 年进入哈佛商学院学习，并卷入了席卷美国校园的反战运动。12

Once hired at Kidder, Peabody out of grad school, Siegel quickly shucked his pacifism for the trench warfare of mergers and acquisitions. Since no one else at this white shoe firm had much interest, Siegel focused on hostile takeovers, despite their unsavory taint. Writes James Stewart in his authoritative account of the scandals,Den of Thieves, “Many of the WASP investment banks and law firms preferred to leave such work to the other firms, many of them Jewish.” 13

一毕业就被 Kidder, Peabody 聘用，西格尔很快就摆脱了他的和平主义，开始了并购的壕沟战。由于这家白鞋公司的其他人都没有什么兴趣，西格尔专注于敌意收购，尽管他们有不光彩的污点。詹姆斯·斯图尔特在他关于这些丑闻的权威描述《贼窝》（Den of Thieves）中写道 ：“许多‘白鞋’投资银行和律师事务所宁愿把这种工作留给其他公司，其中许多是犹太人。” 13

A marriage to a Kidder, Peabody WASP, Jane Day Stuart, the second for both, was thought a bit scandalous, even though Siegel was nonreligious. Still, it helped smooth out Siegel’s “obvious ambitions and sometimes rough edges.” 14With his Harvard degree and Hollywood good looks, Siegel was off and running. Unfortunately, he ran into Ivan Boesky along the way. At the end of the day, Siegel was convinced that Boesky planned to kill him for cooperating with the authorities. That cooperation kept his prison time down to two months and probation to five years. Boesky, who was also cooperating, would serve more than three years.

与基德、皮博迪的‘白鞋’简·戴·斯图尔特结婚，这是两人的第二次婚姻，被认为有点丑闻，尽管西格尔不信教。但是，这仍然有助于磨平西格尔 “明显的野心和有时粗糙的棱角”。14凭借他的哈佛学位和好莱坞的帅气，西格尔开始行动起来。不幸的是，他在这一路上遇到了伊万·博斯基。最后，西格尔确信，博斯基计划杀了他，因为西格尔与当局合作。这种合作使他的监禁时间减少到两个月，缓刑时间为五年。博斯基也在合作，他的刑期将超过三年。

Dennis Levine, born in the modest Queens neighborhood of Bayside in 1952, had little going for him but an almost pathological ambition. His father was a “tin man,” a dealer in aluminum and vinyl siding, who kept his cash and his business records under the bed. During his senior year at a city college, Levine applied to every investment house on Wall Street and got cold-shouldered by them all.15The lack of a white shoe pedigree doomed him, he was convinced, and he remained bitter the rest of his career.

丹尼斯·莱文（Dennis Levine）1952 年出生在皇后区贝赛德（Bayside）的一个普通社区，除了有一种近乎病态的雄心壮志外，他没有什么出息。他的父亲是一个 “铁皮人”，是铝和乙烯基壁板的经销商，他把现金和商业记录放在床底下。15缺乏白鞋血统注定了他的命运，他确信，在他职业生涯的剩余时间里，他一直很苦闷。

Levine used his bitterness as a wedge to recruit others into his schemes. After getting a job at Citicorp, he met a cultured and complacent Harvard grad named Bob Wilkis at a company reception. “You know, we’re just nice Jewish boys in a hostile, WASP environment,” he told Wilkis. “Screw the system!

莱文利用他的苦闷作为楔子，招募其他人加入他的计划。在花旗公司得到一份工作后，他在公司的一个招待会上遇到了一个有教养、自满的哈佛毕业生鲍勃·威尔基斯。“你知道，我们只是在一个充满敌意的‘白鞋’环境中的好犹太男孩”，他告诉威尔基斯。“去他的系统！”

Screw the boss!” 16Insistent and ingratiating, he leaned on a reluctant Wilkis to swap inside information. As reward, Wilkis earned a year in prison, five years probation, and the loss of just about everything he owned. Levine got two years in prison on top of an eleven-million-dollar fine.

“去他的老板！” 16他不断坚持着讨好，从依靠不情愿的威尔基斯交换内部信息。作为回报，威尔基斯被判入狱一年，缓刑五年，并失去了他拥有的几乎所有东西。莱文除了被罚款 1,100 万美元外，还被判处两年监禁。

Easily the most interesting and genuinely innovative of the conspirators was Michael Milken. Milken had grown up as far from Wall Street, emotionally and physically, as a person could — Encino, in Los Angeles’ much-maligned San Fernando Valley. The son of an accountant, Milken was wired into business from boyhood on. While others at Berkeley were busily burning down the campus in the late 1960s, Milken was managing portfolios for family friends and majoring in business administration.17After graduation and marriage, he headed off to Philadelphia and the Wharton School. While at Wharton he took a summer job at the old-line Philadelphia firm then known as Drexel Harriman Ripley. After graduation, lacking the kind of polish and connections that opened doors on Wall Street, Milken stuck with Drexel and went to work in its Wall Street office.

迈克尔·米尔肯(Michael Milken)很可能是这些阴谋家中最有趣和最有创意的。米尔肯是在离华尔街最远的地方长大的，无论从感情上还是从身体上，他都是在洛杉矶备受指责的圣费尔南多谷的恩西诺长大的。米尔肯是一个会计师的儿子，他从小就喜欢做生意。二十世纪 60 年代末，当伯克利的其他人忙着烧毁校园时，米尔肯正在为家庭朋友管理投资组合，并主修工商管理。17毕业和结婚后，他去了费城和沃顿商学院。在沃顿商学院时，他在当时被称为德雷塞尔-哈里曼-里普利的老牌费城公司打了一份暑期工。毕业后，由于缺乏在华尔街打开大门的那种修养和关系，米尔肯坚持在德雷塞尔公司工作，并在其华尔街办事处工作。

It did not much matter where Milken worked or what his title was. He was not to be denied. At Berkeley, he had come across an antique but still relevant study. Its author had reached a startling conclusion: a large and well-diversified portfolio of low-grade bonds would produce higher yields over time than a comparable investment in high-grade bonds.18Since Berkeley, Milken had been testing this idea and honing it. He would leave investment-grade bonds, the kind that major companies issued, to the Morgan Stanleys. They held about as much excitement for him as U.S. Treasury bonds. Instead, he would deal in the bonds issued by shakier outfits — “fallen angels,” start-ups, and highly leveraged acquisitions. Given their lower credit rating, these companies had to pay a higher rate to attract investors. That higher rate translated into high-yield bonds.

米尔肯在哪里工作或他的头衔是什么并不重要。他是不会被拒绝的。在伯克利大学，他看到了一项古老但仍然相关的研究。它的作者得出了一个惊人的结论：随着时间的推移，一个庞大而分散的低等级债券投资组合会比可比的高等级债券投资产生更高的收益。18自伯克利大学以来，米尔肯一直在测试这个想法并加以磨练。他将投资级债券，即大公司发行的那种债券，留给了摩根斯坦利夫妇。这些债券对他来说就像美国国债一样有吸引力。相反，他将交易由更不稳定的公司和 “堕落天使” 、初创公司和高杠杆收购所发行的债券。鉴于其较低的信用评级，这些公司必须支付较高的利率来吸引投资者。这种高利率转化为高收益债券。

At Drexel, Milken began assembling and trading and making money. His colleagues were not impressed. Said one, “The high-grade bond guys considered him a leper.” 19Not surprisingly, their complacency was dragging Drexel down. Despite an infusion of cash from Firestone Tire and Rubber (and a subsequent new name, Drexel Firestone), Drexel was starting to wobble. A Wall Street hustler named Tubby Burnham saw an opportunity. As the head of a small, prosperous, and “submajor” brokerage house, he figured he could achieve “major” bracket status — this mattered on Wall Street — by buying the faltering Drexel. In deference to Wall Street protocol, Drexel had to come first on the nameplate, and so was born Drexel Burnham.

在德雷克塞尔，米尔肯开始组装和交易，并赚了钱。他的同事们对此不以为然。一个人说 ：“高等级债券的人认为他是个麻风病人。” 19毫不奇怪，他们的自满情绪正把德雷塞尔拖垮。尽管有来自费尔斯通（Firestone）轮胎和橡胶公司的现金注入（以及随后的新名字 Drexel Firestone），德雷塞尔还是开始动摇了。一位名叫塔比·伯纳姆（Tubby Burnham）的华尔街老手看到了一个机会。作为一家小型、繁荣的 “次大型” 经纪公司的负责人，他认为他可以通过收购摇摇欲坠的德雷克塞尔来获得 “大型” 的地位 —— 这在华尔街很重要。为了遵守华尔街的礼节，德雷塞尔必须在铭牌上排在第一位，于是德雷塞尔·伯纳姆公司诞生了。

The culture wars were about to begin. Drexel had been the quintessential WASP firm. Burnham was something else. Robert Linton,néRobert Lictenstein, Drexel Burnham’s chairman in the early 1980s, denied that Burnham had been, strictly speaking, a Jewish firm. He explained, “None of the top people practiced their religion. I mean, we weren’t lighting candles.” 20This much would become obvious as the decade wore on.

文化之争即将开始。德雷塞尔是典型的‘白鞋’公司。伯纳姆公司则不同。罗伯特`林顿（Robert Linton），罗伯特·利克滕斯坦（Robert Lictenstein），德雷克塞尔·伯恩汉姆公司 80 年代初的董事长，否认伯恩汉姆公司严格来说是一家犹太人公司。他解释说 ：“没有一个高层人士信奉他们的宗教。我的意思是，我们没有点蜡烛。” 20随着时间的推移，这一点将变得十分明显。

Only after the purchase did Tubby Burnham learn about Drexel Firestone’s primary asset. It was not its name, bracket, or client lineup. The firm’s chief asset was an odd, intense, bewigged twenty-five-year-old working in his own little magical kingdom of schlock bonds. Drexel Firestone’s president advised Burnham that Milken, one of the old Drexel’s handful of Jewish employees, would need special care and feeding if Burnham expected to keep him. When Burnham saw the numbers Milken was producing, he knew this was a leper he could learn to love.

只有在收购之后，塔比·伯纳姆才了解到德雷塞尔·费尔斯通的主要资产。这不是它的名字、支架或客户阵容。该公司的主要资产是一个奇怪的、紧张的、戴着假发的 25 岁年轻人，在他自己的小魔幻王国里工作的笨蛋债券。德雷克塞尔·费尔斯通公司的总裁告诉伯纳姆，米尔肯是老德雷克塞尔公司为数不多的犹太雇员之一，如果伯纳姆想留住他，就需要特别的照顾和喂养。当伯纳姆看到米尔肯创造的数字时，他知道这是一个他可以学会爱的麻风病人。

Levine set his sights on Drexel Burnham as soon as he caught wind of its new go-go corporate culture. Once hired on, he set about recruiting likely conspirators, among them a young attorney named Ilan Reich. As a boy in Brooklyn, Reich had attended ayeshivawhere he spent half the day studying religion. At Columbia University, Stewart explains, “He became increasingly estranged from his family, discarding their orthodox Jewish values without any clear sense of what would replace them.” 21While people like Reich drifted and Levine brooded, Milken filled the void in his religious life with a newfound faith. In what was surely the most unfortunate branding in modern history, this faith came to market under the namejunk bonds.

莱文一听到德雷克塞尔·伯纳姆公司的新企业文化，就把目光投向了它。一旦被录用，他就开始招募可能的同谋，其中包括一位名叫伊兰·赖希的年轻律师。作为布鲁克林的一个男孩，赖希参加了一个犹太教学校（yeshiva），在那里他花了半天时间学习宗教。在哥伦比亚大学，斯图尔特解释说，“他与家人的关系越来越疏远，抛弃了他们的正统犹太价值观，却不清楚什么会取代他们。” 21当像赖希这样的人在漂泊，莱文在沉思时，米尔肯以新发现的信仰填补他宗教生活中的空白。在现代历史上最不幸的品牌效应中，这种信仰以 “垃圾债券” 的名义进入市场。

“He only cared about bringing the truth,” reminisced one Drexel employee of Milken. “If Mike hadn’t gone into the securities business, he could have been a preacher.” 22This was a recurrent theme among those who knew him. “He was like a messiah, preaching the gospel,” recalled one junk bond buyer. “He had this total singlemindedness of purpose.” 23Biographer Connie Bruck describes his life in terms equally well suited to a medieval monk: “a sublimation of all things personal and an utter consecration to his mission.” 24

“他只关心挖掘真相”，一位德雷克塞尔大学的员工回忆起米尔肯。“如果迈克没有进入证券业，他可能会成为一名传教士。” 22这是认识他的人中反复出现的一个主题。“他就像一个救世主，宣扬福音”，一位垃圾债券买家回忆说， “他有这种完全一心一意的目标。” 23传记作者康尼-布鲁克用同样适合于中世纪僧侣的词汇来描述他的生活 ：“所有个人事物的升华和对其使命的彻底奉献”。24

Milken almost never stopped working — seven days a week, twelve, sixteen, twenty hours a day. “I come in in the morning sometime between four-thirty and five,” he would write in an SEC deposition describing his workday. “Sometime around ten forty-five to eleven-fifteen they put some food on my desk which I eat in anywhere from one to five minutes.” 25After moving the entire junk bond operation back to Los Angeles, the now supremely wealthy Milken bought a home not in Beverly Hills or in Bel Air but in Encino. He put eighty thousand miles on a battered yellow Mercedes before he sold it. An egalitarian at work, he had no office of his own and no taste for luxury. Milken’s was not textbook greed.

米尔肯几乎从未停止过工作 —— 一周七天，每天 12、16、20 个小时。“我在早上四点半到五点之间的某个时候进来”，他在美国证券交易委员会的证词中描述了他的工作时间。“大约在 10 点 45 分到 11 点 15 分，他们在我的桌子上放了一些食物，我在 1 到 5 分钟内吃完了。” 25在将整个垃圾债券业务迁回洛杉矶后，现在极其富有的米尔肯不是在比佛利山庄或贝莱尔买了一套房子，而是在恩西诺。他在卖掉一辆破旧的黄色奔驰车之前，已经行驶了 8 万英里。在工作中，他是一个平等主义者，没有自己的办公室，也没有对奢侈品的喜好。米尔肯的贪婪并不是教科书式的。

To a certain point, Milken’s mission had real value. He quickly discovered that Drexel could underwrite public high-yield issues on behalf of a poorly rated company and market them directly to the public. Junk bonds were not just for trading. In his hands, they were highly useful for raising capital. That capital could breathe new life into aging companies and energize start-ups. Milken also hit upon the idea of offering small investors a diversified portfolio of high-yield bonds — in other words, junk bond mutual funds.

在某种程度上，米尔肯的任务具有真正的价值。他很快发现，德雷克塞尔公司可以代表一家评级不佳的公司承销公开发行的高收益债券，并直接向公众推销。垃圾债券不仅仅是为了交易。在他手中，它们对筹集资金非常有用。这些资金可以为老化的公司注入新的活力，并为初创企业注入活力。米尔肯还提出了为小投资者提供多样化的高收益债券组合的想法；换句话说，就是垃圾债券共同基金。

Through high-powered salesmanship — he occasionally crossed paths with mortgage trader Lewie Ranieri in the hunt for investors — the Encino Man was making himself the most powerful manipulator and marketer of debt on the planet. When Milken and his investors bought a company’s bonds, he transformed the traditionally passive role of the bondholder. “You’re working for me,” he told one CEO. “You own a lot of the equity in your companies, but I own your debt. And your equity is not worth the paper it’s printed on unless your bonds are valuable.” 26

通过高能的销售技巧 —— 他偶尔会与抵押贷款交易员路易·拉涅利（Lewie Ranieri）在寻找投资者的道路上擦肩而过 —— 这位恩西诺人正在使自己成为地球上最强大的债务操纵者和营销者。当米尔肯和他的投资者购买一家公司的债券时，他改变了传统上债券持有人的被动角色。“你在为我工作”，他告诉一位首席执行官。“你拥有你们公司的很多股权，但我拥有你们的债务。除非你的债券有价值，否则你的股权就不值得印在纸上。” 26

As his power grew, his ego grew with it. A perfectionist, he demanded of his staff what he demanded of himself and paid them so outrageously well they put up with his screaming and abuse. “It’s a slave ship out there,” said one Drexel investment banker, “high priced slavery.” 27But it was more than just the pay. The staff was awed by Milken, “a charismatic and messianic leader,” says Bruck, “whom many of his figures came to see as larger than life.” 28Milken’s L.A. group, the tail that was wagging the Drexel dog, turned into junk bond apostles. “We owe it all to one man,” said a member of that group, “and we are all extraneous. Michael has denuded us of ego.” 29Chalk it up to his California origins: Milken was the first financier to turn an investment bank into a cult.

随着他权力的增长，他的自负也随之增长。作为一个完美主义者，他对员工的要求和他对自己的要求一样高，而且给他们的报酬也高得离谱，他们忍受着他的叫喊和虐待。“那是一艘奴隶船”，一位德雷克塞尔投资银行家说，“全都是高价的奴隶”。27但是，这不仅仅是工资问题。员工们对米尔肯感到敬畏，“他是一位富有魅力的救世主式的领导人”，布鲁克说，“他的许多人都把他看得比生命还重要。” 28米尔肯的洛杉矶小组，这个摇着德雷塞尔犬的尾巴，变成了垃圾债的使徒。“我们把一切都归功于一个人”，该小组的一名成员说，“我们都是多余的。米尔肯让我们失去了自我。” "29这要归功于他在加州的出身。米尔肯是第一个将投资银行变成邪教的金融家。

As the 1980s progressed, Milken began to use junk bonds to finance hostile takeovers and leveraged buyouts. This, he saw, was where the real power and money were. So keen was he on this use of junk bonds to finance takeovers, and so indifferent had he grown to public opinion, that he began to call his annual high yield conference the Predators’ Ball — the second worst branding call in the history of finance.

随着二十世纪 80 年代的发展，米尔肯开始利用垃圾债券为敌意收购和杠杆收购融资。他认为，这才是真正的权力和金钱所在。他是如此热衷于利用垃圾债券为收购提供资金，而他对公众舆论又是如此漠不关心，以至于他开始把他的年度高收益会议称为 “掠夺者舞会” ；这是金融史上第二糟糕的品牌宣传活动。

Even at this point, there was nothing inevitable about Milken’s downfall. What undid him was his hunger for information. He may have been a god to his employees, but he was not omniscient. In the takeover business, information was everything. An arbitrageur like Boesky — that is, someone who specialized in anticipating takeovers — was tempted to secure information any way possible. ThinkWall Streetand Michael Douglas’s character Gordon Gekko, who was reportedly modeled on Boesky. The line between what an arbitrageur should know and what he should not was easily crossed. Boesky crossed it often — with Milken, with Levine, with Siegel. “This is a highly technical business,” Boesky once explained to a colleague, “and there are grey areas.” 30

即使在这一点上，米尔肯的堕落也没有什么不可避免的。使他失败的是他对信息的渴望。他可能是员工眼中的神，但他并不是无所不知的。在收购业务中，信息就是一切。像博伊斯基这样的套利者，也就是专门预测收购的人，很想以任何可能的方式获得信息。想想《华尔街》和迈克尔·道格拉斯(Michael Douglas)的角色戈登·盖科(Gordon Gekko)，据说他是以博斯基为原型的。一个套利者应该知道什么和不应该知道什么之间的界限很容易被跨越。博斯基经常越过这条线；与米尔肯（Milken），与莱维因（Levine），与西格尔（Siegel）。“这是个技术性很强的行业”，博斯基曾向一位同事解释说，“有一些灰色地带。” 30

Rudy Giuliani did not see it that way. Then the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York, he had, writes Stewart, “a Catholic, even Jesuitical view of the world, one marked by clear divisions between right and wrong, friend and enemy.” 31The chief of the fraud unit, Charles Carberry, like Giuliani a product of Catholic schooling, shared his worldview, as did their collaborators at the SEC. They were also a good deal more competent than Boesky and Milken ever suspected. When Levine was arrested, writes Stewart, “it suggested a level of securities enforcement that neither had previously believed existed.” 32These Reagan appointees also belied the notion that his administration had turned a blind eye to securities fraud.

鲁迪·朱利安尼并不这么看。斯图尔特写道，他当时是纽约南区的美国检察官，“对世界的看法是天主教的，甚至是耶稣教的，其特点是对与错、友与敌的划分很清楚。” 31欺诈部门的负责人查尔斯·卡伯里（Charles Carberry）与朱利安尼一样是天主教学校的学生，与他的世界观一样，他们在证券交易委员会的合作者也是如此。他们的能力也比博斯基和米尔肯所怀疑的要强得多。当莱文被逮捕时，斯图尔特写道，“这表明证券执法的水平是两人以前都不相信存在的。” 32这些里根任命的官员也否定了他的政府对证券欺诈视而不见的说法。

None of the conspirators was a hard guy. “Wall Street types weren’t strong in a criminal sense,” Carberry concluded. “They cared too much about respectability.” 33As George Gilder might have phrased it, in an increasingly secular environment, the Jewish “need for achievement” had persisted while the culture’s “rigorous moral framework” had been set aside.34Still, the conspirators were all just one generation removed from leading lawful, respectful, traditional lives. When finally brought to justice, Milken “emitted bloodcurdling screams.” 35Reich “began sobbing” ;36Siegel “put his head in his hands and began to weep.” 37This was the way the greed decade ended: not with a bang, but a whimper.

同谋者中没有一个是硬汉。“华尔街的人在犯罪方面上并不强大”，卡伯里总结道。“他们太在乎体面的问题。” 33正如乔治·吉尔德可能会说的那样，在一个越来越世俗的环境中，犹太人的 “成就需求” 一直存在，而文化的 “严格的道德框架” 却被搁置了。 34尽管如此，这些阴谋家都只是在过合法的、受尊重的、传统的生活之后的一代。当最终被绳之以法时，米尔肯 “发出了令人血脉喷张的尖叫声。” 35赖克 “开始啜泣” ；36西格尔 “把头放在手中，开始流泪。” 37这就是贪婪的十年的结束方式：不是以爆炸的方式，而是以呜咽的方式。

Though a decade lasts for only ten years, greed is both forever and universal. “The avarice of mankind is insatiable,” 38Aristotle observed some 2,300 years ago, and little has happened in the years since to disprove him. The notion that the 1980s was distinctively greedy can be seen in retrospect for what it was: mischievous anti-Reagan agitprop.

虽然十年只有十年，但贪婪既是永恒的，也是普遍的。“人类的贪婪是贪得无厌的”，38亚里士多德在大约 2300 年前观察到，此后的岁月里几乎没有发生过可以反驳他的事。关于二十世纪 80 年代特别贪婪的说法，现在回过头来可以看到它的本质：恶作剧般的反里根宣传。

For Bernie Madoff, now serving 150 or so years in prison for defrauding thousands of investors out of billions of dollars, the 1980s was merely the third decade out of five in which he spun his impressively sticky web. In fact, he was arguably less greedy in the 1980s than he was in the 1990s and in the 2000s, when his Ponzi scheme was cranking full throttle. And unlike Milken, whose genius revolutionized Wall Street, Madoff did nothing more constructive than steal other people’s money and spend it.

对于伯尼·麦道夫（Bernie Madoff）来说，现在因诈骗数千名投资者的数十亿美元而在监狱中服刑 150 年左右，1980 年代只是他编织令人印象深刻的粘性网络的五个十年中的第三个。事实上，他在 1980 年代可以说没有 1990 年代和 2000 年代那么贪婪，当时他的庞氏骗局正在全速运转。与米尔肯不同的是，麦道夫的天才彻底改变了华尔街，他除了偷别人的钱和花掉它之外，没有做任何更有建设性的事情。

Madoff’s biography reads much like Boesky’s. The grandson of immigrants from Eastern Europe, the son of a struggling plumber turned broker named Ralph, Madoff went to public high school in Queens, bounced around before graduating fromdéclasséHofstra University on Long Island, dropped out of Brooklyn College Law School, and saved enough money from installing sprinkler systems to start up a humble brokerage firm immodestly called Bernard L. Madoff Investment Securities. Like Boesky, Madoff married up. His well-connected father-in-law may have helped with start-up costs, and he certainly helped his son-in-law recruit investors.39

麦道夫的传记读起来很像博斯基的传记。麦道夫是来自东欧的移民的孙子，是一个名叫拉尔夫的水管工变成经纪人的儿子，他在皇后区上了公立高中，在从长岛的 déclassé 霍夫斯特拉大学毕业之前四处碰壁，从布鲁克林学院法学院辍学，并从安装洒水系统中攒够了钱，创办了一家不起眼的经纪公司，不谦虚地称之为伯纳德·麦道夫投资证券。和博伊斯基一样，麦道夫也嫁了出去。他那关系良好的岳父可能帮助了启动费用，他当然也帮助女婿招募投资者。39

Although not religious by inclination — he described himself as “a lox and bagel Jew” 40—— Madoff played on tribal loyalties to snare customers. He proved particularly skillful in exploiting his fellow Jews’ pride in their historical business savvy. “This isn’t about a bunch of widows and orphans that got taken in by some huckster selling vacuum cleaners door-to-door,” one insider told Mark Seal, theVanity Fairwriter who has done some of the best reporting on Madoff. “He hit smart people. The ones who are really rich have big egos, and they don’t want to look stupid.” 41

虽然没有宗教倾向 —— 他把自己描述为 “爱吃一个熏鲑鱼和百吉饼的犹太人”。40—— 麦道夫利用部落忠诚来诱骗客户。事实证明，他特别善于利用犹太人同胞对其历史上的商业智慧的自豪感。“这不是关于一群寡妇和孤儿被一些挨家挨户卖吸尘器的小贩收买”，一位内部人士告诉马克·海尔，《名利场》（Vanity Fair）的作家对麦道夫进行了一些最好的报道。“他打击的是聪明人。那些真正富有的人有很大的自尊心，他们不想看起来很愚蠢。” 41

Among his customers, for instance, was old buddy and New York Mets owner Fred Wilpon, who would invest hundreds of millions with Madoff. For years, Wilpon boasted about the Madoff connection. “He must feel like a total fool,” one Wall Street observer said of Wilpon after Madoff’s arrest. “Here’s a nice enough guy, decent and honorable, but he tended to brag that he had deals that were better than other people’s.” 42

例如，在他的客户中，有老伙计、纽约大都会队老板弗雷德·威尔朋（Fred Wilpon），他将与麦道夫一起投资数亿美元。多年来，威尔彭一直在吹嘘与麦道夫的关系。“他一定觉得自己是个十足的傻瓜”，一位华尔街的观察家在麦道夫被捕后这样评价威尔彭。“这是个足够好的人，正派而光荣，但他倾向于吹嘘他有比别人更好的交易。” 42

If Madoff’s business model was pure Ponzi, his style was more Goldman Sachs. He moved in the best circles, donated to the right causes, and paid out only 10 to 12 percent annual interest, not the outrageous returns that Ponzi had. But Madoff paid that percentage year in and year out, good years and bad. This consistent high yield attracted investors. So, too, did the snob appeal. Getting in with the imperious Bernie was like getting a table at Le Cirque on a Saturday night. He did not take everyone.

如果说麦道夫的商业模式是纯粹的庞氏骗局，那么他的风格则更像是高盛集团。他在最好的圈子里活动，向正确的事业捐款，并且只支付 10% 到 12% 的年利息，而不是像庞氏那样有令人发指的回报。但麦道夫年复一年地支付这个百分比，无论是好年景还是坏年景。这种持续的高收益吸引了投资者。所以，势利眼的吸引力也是如此。与傲慢的伯尼在一起就像在星期六晚上在马戏团得到一张桌子。他并不接受所有人。

Ground zero in Madoff’s world was Palm Beach, specifically the Palm Beach Country Club. The predominantly Jewish club accepted members not on how much money they had —— a $350,000 initiation screened out the chiropractors in any case — but on how much money they gave away. There was no self-reporting allowed here, as there was on home loans. Charitable histories were reviewed and assessed. In the age of securitization, club leaders had proved that even good deeds could be bundled and commoditized.

在麦道夫的世界里，棕榈滩是起点，特别是棕榈滩乡村俱乐部。这个以犹太人为主的俱乐部接受会员，不是看他们有多少钱 —— 无论如何，35 万美元的入会费把脊医都筛掉了；而是看他们送了多少钱。这里不允许自我报告，就像房屋贷款那样。慈善历史被审查和评估。在证券化的时代，俱乐部领导人证明了即使是善行也可以被捆绑和商品化。

Prominent philanthropist Carl Shapiro, something of a surrogate father to Madoff, opened Palm Beach’s golden gates to Madoff. Shapiro’s son-in-law, Robert Jaffe, served as gatekeeper. As many as one-third of the club’s three hundred members would come calling. Up until the day of Madoff’s arrest, Shapiro and Jaffe had no idea of the nightmare they had enabled. Said the ninetysomething Shapiro upon learning of Madoff’s deceit, “It was like a knife to the heart.” 43

杰出的慈善家卡尔·夏皮罗（Carl Shapiro）是麦道夫的代理父亲，他为麦道夫打开了棕榈滩的金色大门。夏皮罗的女婿罗伯特·贾菲担任看门人。俱乐部的三百名成员中，有多达三分之一的人会来找他。直到麦道夫被捕的那一天，夏皮罗和贾菲还不知道他们促成了一场噩梦。在得知麦道夫的欺骗行为后，90 多岁的夏皮罗说 ：“这就像一把刀刺进了心脏。” 43

When Madoff was arrested in December 2008, an emotional tsunami ripped through Palm Beach and sent shock waves around the world. Thousands of people had invested some fifty billion dollars with Madoff — many of them unknowingly, through feeder funds — and, as they learned to their horror, it was all gone. Gone with the money was the confidence, the pride, the sense of personal and communal superiority. “What Hitler didn’t finish, he did!” 44an overly dramatic doyenne of Palm Beach Jewish society told Seal.

当麦道夫在 2008 年 12 月被捕时，一场情感海啸撕裂了棕榈滩，并在全世界掀起了冲击波。成千上万的人在麦道夫那里投资了大约 500 亿美元；其中许多人是在不知情的情况下，通过联接基金投资的；而且，当他们惊恐地得知，这一切都消失了。“与钱一起消失的还有信心、自豪感、个人和集体的优越感。” 44棕榈滩犹太社会的一位过于夸张的女主人告诉希尔。

Unlike the scandals of the 1980s, the Madoff revelations had a distinctly Jewish face, and Jews everywhere, especially in Palm Beach, were turning red. “The anti-Semites are ecstatic,” 45lamented one Palm Beach resident. She was speaking not of skinheads in Paducah but the WASPs in Palm Beach. A more accurate word to describe the response isschadenfreude, a guilty delight in the suffering of others. One did not have to be an anti-Semite to enjoy it. Nearly a century earlier, after Ponzi’s arrest, theNew York Timesreadily acknowledged the community’s “lack of sympathy for those whom he robbed.” These victims, theTimeseditorialized, “showed only greed — the eagerness to get much for nothing.” 46

与二十世纪 80 年代的丑闻不同，麦道夫事件的披露具有明显的犹太色彩，各地的犹太人，尤其是棕榈滩的犹太人，都变得面红耳赤。“反犹太主义者欣喜若狂”，45一位棕榈滩居民哀叹道。她说的不是帕杜卡的光头党，而是棕榈滩的‘白鞋’们。用一个更准确的词来形容这种反应是幸灾乐祸（schadenfreude），一种对他人痛苦的有罪的喜悦。人们不一定非得是反犹太主义者才能享受这种乐趣。近一个世纪以前，在庞氏被捕后，《纽约时报》欣然承认社会 “对被他抢劫的人缺乏同情”。“这些受害者”，编辑说，“只表现出贪婪 —— 渴望不劳而获。” 46

If the media treated Madoff’s victims more sympathetically, they let it be known that investors had every reason to be suspicious. The returns were too consistently good. As early as May 2001,Barron’sreporter Erin Arvedlund had shared this news with Wall Street. “Even adoring investors can’t explain his steady gains,” 47she wrote in an article titled “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell: Bernie Madoff Is So Secretive, He Even Asks Investors to Keep Mum.” Arvedlund noted that in a then-recent report, a dozen hedge fund professionals had questioned why no one had been able to duplicate Madoff’s numbers. She quoted one investment manager who pulled out of a Madoff fund because “he couldn’t explain how they were up or down in a given month.” 48

如果媒体对麦道夫的受害者更加同情，他们让人们知道，投资者完全有理由感到怀疑。回报太过持续良好。早在 2001 年 5 月，《巴朗》（Barron）的记者艾琳·阿维德伦（Erin Arvedlund）就与华尔街分享了这个消息 ：“即使是崇拜的投资者也无法解释他的稳定收益”，47她在一篇题为《不要问，不要说》 ：“麦道夫是如此神秘，他甚至要求投资者保持沉默。” 阿维德伦指出，在当时的一份报告中，十几位对冲基金专业人士质疑为什么没有人能够复制麦道夫的数字。她引用了一位从麦道夫基金中撤出的投资经理的话，因为 “他无法解释他们在某个月的涨跌情况。” 48

When Laura Goldman, a broker and analyst, sent this article and others to the members of the Palm Beach Country Club in 2001, the response she got was shockingly cold. “Oh, they were nasty!Nasty!” Goldman told Seal. “They said all these publications were jealous of Bernie. They were being anti-Semitic. People called me an anti-Semite. I’m not only a Jew, I live in Israel!” 49

当经纪人和分析师劳拉·戈德曼在 2001 年将这篇文章和其他文章发送给棕榈滩乡村俱乐部的成员时，她得到的回应是令人震惊的冷淡。“哦，他们很讨厌！讨厌！” 戈德曼告诉希尔。“他们说所有这些出版物都在嫉妒伯尼。他们是在反犹太主义。人们说我是反犹太主义者。我不仅是个犹太人，我还住在以色列！” 49

Madoff’s most serious critic, private fraud investigator Harry Markopolos, had no more success than Goldman in warning the public. Markopolos had alerted the SEC as early as 2000, and in 2005 sent regulators a nineteen-page memo entitled “The World’s Largest Hedge Fund Is a Fraud.” 50The SEC had neither the patience nor the competence to deal with Markopolos, and, as Goldman can attest, Madoff’s investors just did not want to know.

马多夫最严重的批评者，私人欺诈调查员哈里·马可波罗斯(Harry Markopolos)在警告公众方面没有比高盛更成功。马可波罗斯早在 2000 年就向美国证券交易委员会发出警告，并在 2005 年向监管机构发送了一份长达 19 页的备忘录，题为 《世界上最大的对冲基金是一个骗局》。50SEC 既没有耐心也没有能力处理马可波罗斯的警告，而且，正如高盛可以证明的，麦道夫的投资者就是不想知道。

When they found out the truth about Madoff, many of the investors responded with the outraged innocence of a subprime borrower whose adjustable rate mortgage had just adjusted up. “I want to be treated like GM and A.I.G. and Bank of America!” one raged to Mark Seal. “I can’t wait years!” Said another, “I need people to know that the SEC failed miserably for at least 10 years, if not more, that they were warned, and that they didn’t stop this devil from doing his deed.” 51

当他们发现麦道夫的真相时，许多投资者以次贷者的愤怒无辜来回应，他们的可调利率抵押贷款刚刚调高。“我想得到像通用汽车、A.I.G. 和美国银行那样的待遇！” 一个人对马克·海尔愤怒地说。“我等不了几年了！” 另一个人说 ：“我需要人们知道，美国证券交易委员会至少惨败了十年，甚至更久，他们被警告过，而且他们没有阻止这个魔鬼的行为。” 51

Los Angeles rabbi Mark Borovitz, himself a reformed con artist, understood just how Jewish pride had fed into Madoff’s ambitions. “Whether it’s Latino or black or Jewish or Christian, everybody wants to trust their own. Bernie Madoff took our trust and raped it,” said Borovitz. “He took advantage of every vulnerability, because he knew our vulnerable spots.” 52

洛杉矶拉比马克·博罗维茨（Mark Borovitz）自己也是一个改过自新的骗子，他明白犹太人的骄傲是如何助长麦道夫的野心的。“无论是拉丁裔还是黑人，还是犹太裔或基督徒，每个人都想信任自己的。伯尼·麦道夫拿走了我们的信任并强奸了它”，博罗维茨说。“他利用了每一个弱点，因为他知道我们的弱点。” 52

twenty-sevenAge of Innocence 无知时代

ON JANUARY 31, 2006, ALAN GREENSPAN PUSHED THROUGH THE FINAL interest rate hike of his eighteen-year career as chairman of the Federal Reserve. This was the fourteenth consecutive increase in a tightening cycle that had begun in June 2004, when the federal funds rate stood at an improbably low 1 percent. The world, however, paid less attention to the hike than it did to the heroics of the man behind it. The headline of theLondon Independentsummed up the international take on his career: “Greenspan steps down as Fed chief with his reputation at its zenith.” 1

2006 年 1 月 31 日，艾伦·格林斯潘推动了他作为美联储主席 18 年职业生涯中的最后一次加息。这是在 2004 年 6 月开始的紧缩周期中连续第十四次加息，当时联邦基金利率维持在不可能的 1% 的低水平。然而，世界对这次加息的关注少于对其背后人物的英雄事迹的关注。《伦敦独立报》的标题总结了国际上对他职业生涯的看法 ：“格林斯潘在他的声誉达到顶峰时卸任美联储主席。” 1

A continent away in Calabasas, California, the news of still another rate hike had to drain a little color from Angelo Mozilo’s eternal tan. A federal funds rate now at 4.5 percent meant a prime of 7.5 percent and a further constriction of the customer pipeline. Still, with shares in his company selling at more than forty dollars and a market share nearing 20 percent, the highest of any mortgage company in the nation, the chairman and CEO of Countrywide Financial enjoyed an esteem, if not at Greenspan’s level, not too far below.

在加州卡拉巴萨斯，再次加息的消息不得不让安吉洛·莫齐洛(Angelo Mozilo)永恒的皮肤失去一点色彩。联邦基金利率现在是 4.5%，意味着 7.5% 的优惠利率和客户管道的进一步收缩。不过，由于他的公司股票售价超过 40 美元，市场份额接近 20%，是全美所有抵押贷款公司中最高的，全美金融公司的董事长兼首席执行官享有一种尊重，即使没有达到格林斯潘的水平，也不会太低。

Mozilo and Greenspan had grown up within a few miles of each other, Greenspan in the northern reaches of Manhattan, Mozilo in the Bronx. When Greenspan was about three, his parents divorced. He went on to live with his mother, who worked sales in a furniture store.2From the age of ten, Mozilo worked in his father’s butcher shop.3Greenspan graduated from George Washington High School three years behind Henry Kissinger and left for college — on a daily basis — via the A train down to NYU. Mozilo kept to his borough for college as well, graduating from Fordham University, not far from his Bronx home.

莫齐洛和格林斯潘在彼此几英里范围内长大，格林斯潘在曼哈顿北部，莫齐洛在布朗克斯。在格林斯潘大约三岁的时候，他的父母离婚了。他继续与他的母亲生活在一起，母亲在一家家具店做销售。2从 10 岁开始，莫齐洛在父亲的肉店工作。 3格林斯潘比亨利·基辛格晚三年从乔治·华盛顿高中毕业，然后去上大学，每天通过 A 火车到纽约大学。莫齐洛上大学时也留在了他所在的区，从离他布朗克斯的家不远的福特汉姆大学毕业。

Greenspan was Jewish. Mozilo was of Italian descent. His butcher father, in fact, had been an immigrant. That the two New Yorkers would play so crucial a role in stimulating America’s economy seems somehow fitting. Jews and Italians had been responsible for much, if not most, of the world’s credit innovations. The Medici conceived international investment banking. The Rothschilds perfected it. Salomon Brothers first securitized mortgages. Ranieri godfathered the phenomenon for Salomon and branded it. Ponzi put his name on the pyramid scheme. Madoff put his signature on the Ponzi scheme. Moses, with a little help from above, originated the ban on usury. The Italian popes enforced it.

格林斯潘是犹太人。莫齐洛是意大利人的后裔。事实上，他的屠夫父亲也是一名移民。这两个纽约人将在刺激美国经济方面发挥如此关键的作用，这在某种程度上是合适的。犹太人和意大利人对世界信贷创新的大部分（如果不是大部分的话）负有责任。美第奇家族构想了国际投资银行。罗斯柴尔德家族完善了它。所罗门兄弟公司首次将抵押贷款证券化。拉涅利为萨洛蒙做了教父，并给它打上了品牌。庞齐把他的名字放在了金字塔计划上。麦道夫在庞氏骗局上签下了自己的名字。摩西，在上天的小小帮助之下，提出了禁止高利贷的禁令。意大利教皇执行了它。

Greenspan and Mozilo may not have been aware of credit’s cultural history, but in the fifty or so years since interest rates had last seen 1 percent, they had watched that history unfold. However gradually, the culture had changed around them. Although it would not have been obvious from following the media, that shift had less to do with the behavior of “usurers” in any of their manifestations — from community banker to bond salesman to loan sharks — than it did with the behavior of consumers, especially the prodigals among them.

格林斯潘和莫齐洛可能没有意识到信贷的文化历史，但在利率最后一次达到 1% 后的五十多年里，他们目睹了这段历史的展开。然而渐渐地，他们周围的文化已经发生了变化。虽然从媒体上看不出来，但这种变化与 “高利贷者” 的行为关系不大，他们的表现形式有：从社区银行家到债券推销员再到高利贷者，而与消费者的行为关系不大，特别是他们中的败家子。

Wall Street culture had changed — in some ways for the better. The whiteness of one’s shoes still counted, but not as much as it used to. Ethnicity mattered less and merit more than it had just a few decades back. “Quants” —— people who could do the math — emerged as real powers. Savvy traders had more value than ever. And up-from-the-mailroom hustlers were still finding their way to the trading floor. InBonfire of the Vanities ——the title an allusion to Savonarola’s scorching of the Medici — Tom Wolfe captured the essence of contemporary Wall Street through the eyes of ace bond salesman Sherman McCoy:

华尔街的文化已经发生了变化；在某些方面是好的。一个人的鞋子是否洁白仍然重要，但不像以前那样重要了。与几十年前相比，种族问题不那么重要了，而优点则更多。“商人” —— 会算账的人 —— 作为真正的力量出现了。精明的商人比以前更有价值。而来自邮件室的骗子们仍在寻找他们进入交易大厅的途径。在《虚荣的火焰》（Bonfire of the Vanities）中 —— 标题暗指萨沃纳罗拉对美第奇家族的炙烤 —— 汤姆·沃尔夫通过王牌债券销售员谢尔曼·麦考伊的眼睛捕捉到了当代华尔街的本质：

He considered himself part of the new era and the new breed, a Wall Street egalitarian, a Master of the Universe who respected only performance. No longer did Wall Street mean Protestant Good Family. There were plenty of prominent Jewish investment bankers. Lopwitz himself was Jewish. There were plenty of Irishmen, Greeks, and Slavs. The fact that not one of the eighty members of the bond department was black or female didn’t bother him. Why should it? It didn’t bother Lopwitz, who took the position that the bond trading room at Pierce & Pierce was no place for symbolic gestures.4

他认为自己是新时代和新品种的一部分，是华尔街的平等主义者，是只尊重业绩的宇宙之主。华尔街不再意味着新教徒的好家庭。有很多杰出的犹太投资银行家。罗普威茨（Lopwitz）本人也是犹太人。还有很多爱尔兰人、希腊人和斯拉夫人。债券部的 80 名成员中没有一个是黑人或女性，这一事实并没有困扰他。为什么要这样呢？他认为皮尔斯公司的债券交易室不适合做象征性的动作。4

On the potential downside, the major investment houses had largely shifted from partnerships to corporations, and if this democratized Wall Street, it also diminished long-term loyalty and distanced executives from the consequences of failure. As to ethics, internal controls had eroded a bit in the last century, but enhanced external controls had largely compensated for the erosion.

在潜在的不利因素方面，主要的投资机构在很大程度上已经从合伙企业转变为公司，如果这使华尔街民主化，它也削弱了长期的忠诚度，使高管们远离失败的后果。在道德方面，内部控制在上个世纪受到了一定程度的侵蚀，但强化的外部控制在很大程度上弥补了这种侵蚀。

Wall Street’s new corporate culture, however, aggravated a problem with the quants. Unless given lots of room and money, these “young professors” felt free to take their highly profitable show someplace else. The typical CEO, who often had little idea what these guys were doing, hesitated to look too closely. He was, as Michael Lewis put it, the “hostage of his cleverest employee.” 5

然而，华尔街的新企业文化加剧了数量主义者的一个问题。除非得到大量的空间和金钱，这些 “年轻的教授” 感到可以自由地把他们的高利润节目带到其他地方。典型的首席执行官，往往不知道这些人在做什么，所以犹豫不决，不敢看得太仔细。正如迈克尔·刘易斯所说，他是 “他最聪明的雇员的人质”。5

Any organized religious opposition to credit that might have existed when Mozilo and Greenspan were boys, and there was little even then, had largely exhausted itself. In its place there surfaced a vaguely socialist animus against the dispensers of credit that had all the moral coherence of a grudge. Ordinary Americans meanwhile retained as sneaky an affection for the “successful scoundrel” as they had in Dickens’s time — how many cheerful movies has Hollywood made about con men? —— but as Madoff and Boesky could surely attest, the public could turn on those sharp dealers in a heartbeat if its own interests were threatened.

在莫齐洛和格林斯潘还是孩子的时候，任何有组织的宗教反对信贷的声音都可能存在，甚至在那时也很少，但现在已经基本用完了。取而代之的是一种对信贷发放者的模糊的社会主义敌意，这种敌意在道德上的连贯性就像一种怨恨。同时，普通美国人对 “成功的无赖” 保持着偷偷摸摸的喜爱，就像他们在狄更斯的时代一样；好莱坞拍了多少关于骗子的欢快电影？ 但正如麦道夫和博斯基可以肯定地证明，如果自己的利益受到威胁，公众可以在第一时间对这些敏锐的交易员采取行动。

As to consumers, they had, in fact, become more dependent on credit. Between 1980 and 2000, for instance, outstanding consumer debt rose from $355 million to $1,560 million. But raw numbers here mislead. More than 80 percent of consumer debt was tied up in home mortgages. As home prices escalated, mortgages grew, and so did debt. The attitude toward debt, however, had changed little. From the Mayflower on, Americans have struggled with it. If individuals yielded to its seductions as Thomas Jefferson had, most Americans continued to resist, as Benjamin Franklin had implored them to, even in the face of Madison Avenue’s siren song. For all the blather about the seductive wiles of the credit industry, at least 40 percent of American credit card users spurned its advances and paid their bills in full on a monthly basis.

至于消费者，事实上，他们已经变得更加依赖信贷。例如，在 1980 年和 2000 年之间，未偿还的消费者债务从 3.55 亿美元上升到 15.6 亿美元。但这里的原始数字误导了人们。超过 80% 的消费者债务被捆绑在房屋抵押贷款上。随着房屋价格的上涨，抵押贷款的增加，债务也在增加。然而，人们对债务的态度却没有什么变化。从 “五月花号” 开始，美国人就在与债务作斗争。如果说个人像托马斯·杰斐逊那样屈服于债务的诱惑，那么大多数美国人则像本杰明·富兰克林所恳求的那样继续抵抗，即使面对麦迪逊大道的警笛声。对于所有关于信贷业诱人伎俩的大肆宣扬，至少有 40% 的美国信用卡用户拒绝了它的诱惑，并按月全额支付他们的账单。

If there was a major cultural shift among relevant cohorts over the past fifty years, it had been among prodigals. Their impulse — “to take because they wish to spend” —— had not changed since Aristotle’s days. What had changed, however, was society’s willingness to oblige them when they tried “to take recklessly and from any source.” One reason for this was that prodigals had reached a certain critical mass — had, in fact, become something like a voting bloc.

如果说在过去的 50 年里，相关人群中出现了重大的文化转变，那就是败家子们。他们的冲动 —— “因为他们想花钱而拿” —— 自亚里士多德的时代以来没有改变。然而，改变的是，当他们试图 “不顾一切地从任何渠道获取” 时，社会愿意为他们提供帮助。其中一个原因是，败家子们已经达到了一定的临界质量 —— 事实上，他们已经成为类似投票集团的东西。

In the 1950 census, families made up 89 percent of all American households. By 2000, that figure had dropped to 68 percent. But even this does not tell the whole story. “Family” figures include single-parent households, and this had proved the fastest growing of family cohorts, from 10 percent of all households in 1970 to 16 percent in 2000. In that same period, the “traditional” family took the biggest hit. By century’s end, married couples with their own children made up only 24 percent of all households, down from 40 percent just thirty years earlier.6

在 1950 年的人口普查中，家庭占美国家庭总数的 89%。到 2000 年，这一数字下降到 68%。但即使这样也不能说明全部问题。“家庭” 数字包括单亲家庭，这已被证明是家庭群组中增长最快的，从 1970 年占所有家庭的 10% 到 2000 年的 16%。在同一时期，“传统” 家庭受到的打击最大。到本世纪末，有自己孩子的已婚夫妇只占所有家庭的 24%，低于三十年前的 40%。6

Accelerating the transition has been the major media’s celebration of the new family dynamic. One faux-objective feature after another has sneakily endorsed “the steady, profound change in Americans’ concept of family.” 7Unfortunately, all thePeoplemagazine stories about Madonna or Jodie Foster do not help ordinary single mothers make their mortgage payments. This is not to suggest that alternative families are intrinsically prodigal, but pressure from the media and government to put them in homes of their own was making them so in great numbers.

加速转型的是主要媒体对新家庭动态的庆祝。一个又一个假客观的专题报道偷偷地赞同 “美国人的家庭观念发生了稳定而深刻的变化”。7不幸的是，所有《大众杂志》（People）关于麦当娜或朱迪·福斯特的故事都不能帮助普通单身母亲支付房贷。这并不是说另类家庭本质上是败家子回头，而是来自媒体和政府的压力，要求他们住进自己的房子，这让他们大量地这样做。

Despite increasing prosperity, despite the growth in the condominium market, these cultural trends conspired to keep a lid on the home-ownership rate. When Bill Clinton was inaugurated in 1993, the rate was lower than it had been when Richard Nixon was inaugurated in 1969. Yet across the political spectrum, everyone agreed that Americans had a veritable manifest destiny to own their own homes. Indeed, presidents since Herbert Hoover had been doing their damnedest to boost the numbers.

尽管日益繁荣，尽管公寓市场的增长，这些文化趋势合力压制了住房拥有率。当比尔·克林顿在 1993 年就职时，该比率比理查德·尼克松在 1969 年就职时的比率还要低。然而，在不同的政治光谱中，每个人都认为美国人拥有自己的房子是名副其实的天命所归。事实上，自赫伯特·胡佛(Herbert Hoover)以来，历届总统都在尽最大努力来提高这一数字。

The numbers, however, were frozen. The decline in two-parent families was negating the increase in prosperity. How could it not? In 1993, the average income for households headed by divorced women was 40 percent that of married couples; for unmarried women it was only 20 percent. As the numbers suggest, many of these women could not manage homes of their own. Home-ownership rates for female-headed households struggled to stay above 50 percent. For married couples, they hovered consistently in the 80 percentile range. With blacks overrepresented among single families — by 1993, 57 percent of black children were growing up in a single-parent household, as compared to 21 percent of white children — white home-ownership rates inevitably outstripped those for black home ownership. In the early 1990s, that gap was at least 25 percentage points, around 70 percent for whites and in the low 40s for blacks.8

然而，这些数字却被冻结。双亲家庭的减少否定了繁荣的增长。这怎么可能不影响呢？1993 年，以离婚妇女为户主的家庭的平均收入是已婚夫妇的 40%；未婚妇女的平均收入只有 20%。正如这些数字所表明的，这些妇女中的许多人无法管理自己的家。女户主家庭的住房拥有率努力保持在 50% 以上。对于已婚夫妇来说，他们一直徘徊在 80％的范围内。到 1993 年，57% 的黑人儿童在单亲家庭中长大，而白人儿童只有 21%；白人的住房拥有率不可避免地超过了黑人的住房拥有率。在 20 世纪 90 年代初，这一差距至少为 25 个百分点，白人为 70% 左右，黑人为 40 多岁。8

The chattering classes, however, refused to acknowledge family breakdown as a problem, let alone as an explanation for the disparity in home-ownership rates. Their preferred explanation for just about everything unpleasant was the inevitable racism. This they could and would freely impute to less enlightened Americans, especially the business classes. Ignoring all contrary evidence, they found what they were looking for in a 1991 study by the Federal Reserve. According to the study, 61 percent of blacks had been approved in their quest for government-backed home loans as compared to 77 percent for whites.9Bingo!

然而，喋喋不休的人们拒绝承认家庭破裂是一个问题，更不用说是对住房拥有率差距的解释。他们对所有令人不快的事情的首选解释是不可避免的种族主义。他们可以并愿意将此归咎于不太开明的美国人，特别是商业阶层。无视所有相反的证据，他们在美联储 1991 年的一项研究中找到了他们要找的东西。根据这项研究，61% 的黑人在寻求政府支持的住房贷款时获得了批准，而白人则为 77%。9Bingo！

The study conceded a lack of information about “the creditworthiness of applicants” as well as “the adequacy of the collateral offered,” 10but for the media these limitations were mere quibble. They wanted to believe that lenders in late-century America would willingly sacrifice their own profits to keep the black man down, and they were not about to let facts stand in the way.

该研究承认缺乏关于 “申请人的信用度” 以及 “所提供的抵押品是否充足” 的信息，10但对媒体来说，这些限制仅仅是争论。他们想相信，在世纪末的美国，贷款人会心甘情愿地牺牲自己的利润来压制黑人，他们不打算让事实挡在前面。

“Getting turned down for a mortgage may have more to do with how you look than how much you make,” 11led aUSA Todayeditorial. A front-page story in theWall Street Journalbegan, “When it comes to buying a home, not all Americans are created equal.” 12Focusing only on the negative and using the wordtwicegenerously, both theJournaland theNew York Timespitched their stories from the perspective that blacks were “twice as likely” to have their home loans denied as whites. This made for a much more sensational hook than “Most black applicants get home loans” or “Higher percentage of whites denied home loans than Asian-Americans.”

“申请抵押贷款被拒可能与你的外表而不是你的收入有很大关系”，11《今日美国》编辑的一篇文章如此开头。《华尔街日报》的头版报道开始说 ：“说到买房，并非所有美国人都是平等的。” 12只关注负面的东西，并普遍使用两次这个词，《今日美国》和《纽约时报》都从黑人的房屋贷款被拒绝的可能性是白人的 “两倍” 这一角度来阐述他们的故事。这比 “大多数黑人申请者获得住房贷款” 或 “白人被拒绝住房贷款的比例高于亚裔美国人” 更有吸引力。

To make the racism story line work, the media had to ignore another significant set of data, namely, default rates. In 2004, the Department of Housing and Urban Development did a comprehensive study of FHA loans that originated in 1992. The sample size was substantial, nearly 250,000 loans. Given that the FHA insures only modest loans for low- and moderate-income people, the crossracial comparisons were for comparable properties. What the study revealed, among other results, was that after the seven prosperous years from 1992 to 1999, blacks were defaulting on their loans more than twice as frequently as whites, and Hispanics were defaulting three times more frequently — the latter in a worrisome 13 percent range. If minorities had been held to a higher standard, their default rates should have been lower than whites, not higher.13

为了让种族主义的故事线发挥作用，媒体不得不忽视另一组重要数据，即违约率。2004 年，住房和城市发展部对 1992 年产生的美国联邦保险协会贷款进行了全面研究。样本量很大，将近 25 万份贷款。鉴于美国联邦保险协会只为低收入和中等收入的人提供适度的贷款，跨种族的比较是针对可比的财产。研究显示，除其他结果外，从 1992 年到 1999 年的七年繁荣期过后，黑人拖欠贷款的频率是白人的两倍多，西班牙裔拖欠贷款的频率是白人的三倍；后者的拖欠率在 13% 左右，令人担忧。如果少数民族被赋予了更高的标准，他们的违约率应该低于白人，而不是更高。13

Another in-depth study on the years 1991 to 1996 concluded that divorced women were “significantly more likely to default than divorced men and married households.” 14By the end of that period, the default rates among divorced women had more than doubled from 1991. This breakdown fed the surge in bankruptcies. The housing officials of either party had to know this. They simply chose not to share this information, and the media chose not to request it.

另一项关于 1991 年至 1996 年的深入研究认为，离婚妇女 “明显比离婚男子和已婚家庭更容易违约”。14到该时期末，离婚妇女的违约率已比 1991 年增加一倍以上。这种破裂助长了破产的激增。任何一方的住房官员都必须知道这一点。他们只是选择不分享这些信息，而媒体也选择不要求这些信息。

At the Fed, meanwhile, Greenspan, a friend and acolyte of überlibertarian Ayn Rand, had accommodated himself to his ironic role as chief regulator of an economy that Rand believed was better left unregulated. He had, however, taken his lumps along the way. In October 1987, just three months into the job, Greenspan got the jolt of a regulator’s lifetime when the Dow plunged 508 points. By sheer numbers or by percentage, this had been the greatest one-day descent in the market’s history.

同时，在美联储，格林斯潘是自由主义者艾恩·兰德的朋友和信徒，他已经适应了自己作为首席监管者的讽刺角色，兰德认为经济最好不受监管。然而，他在这一过程中也吃了不少苦头。1987 年 10 月，格林斯潘上任仅三个月，就受到了一个监管者一生中最严重的打击，道琼斯指数暴跌 508 点。无论从数字还是百分比来看，这都是市场历史上最大的单日跌幅。

In large part, Black Monday owed its scary existence to a series of new products from Wall Street’s whiz kids that might generically be described as “portfolio insurance.” The insurance could take a variety of forms, but most of them involved derivatives and computer-dependent portfolio math.15Theoretically at least, big institutional buyers like pension funds and mutual funds could offset potential losses through a computer-based hedging strategy. The strategy was typically structured in such a way that when the portfolio prices started to drop, the computer program triggered more futures sales to offset the decline.

在很大程度上，黑色星期一的可怕存在要归功于华尔街的奇才们推出的一系列新产品，这些产品可以被概括为 “投资组合保险”。15至少在理论上，养老基金和共同基金等大型机构买家可以通过基于计算机的对冲策略抵消潜在损失。该策略的结构通常是，当投资组合价格开始下降时，计算机程序会触发更多的期货销售以抵消下降。

This system made perfect sense as long as only a few traders were on to it, but when everyone yielded their decisions to roughly the same programs, the computers took over the trading room floor. After a few anxious days at the end of the previous week, and a nervous weekend, the computers kicked off Monday morning, October 19, in a selling frenzy that did not cease until the market had lost 23 percent of its value.

只要只有少数交易员对这个系统感兴趣，这个系统就很有意义，但是当所有人都把自己的决定权交给大致相同的程序时，计算机就接管了交易室的大厅。经过前一周结束时的几天焦虑，以及一个紧张的周末，计算机在 10 月 19 日星期一早上掀起了一场卖出狂潮，直到市场损失了 23% 的价值才停止。

At 8:40 the next morning, Greenspan responded to the crash with just one sentence: “The Federal Reserve, consistent with its responsibilities as the nation’s central bank, affirmed today its readiness to support the economic and financial system.” 16This brevity represented not the soul of wit but the soul of uncertainty. Greenspan did not know what else to do, and the market may have sensed it as it continued to crash. Then around 1:00 p.m., some unknown investors commenced to buy the stocks back, and the market began its largest rally in history. “Several people or firms might have operated in concert to manipulate the market,” Robert Woodward notes in his Greenspan biography,Maestro. “That was technically a scheme and possibly illegal.” 17If so, no one wanted to know. In the spirit of J. P. Morgan, this cabal had quite likely rescued the economy.

第二天早上 8 点 40 分，格林斯潘只用一句话回应了这次崩溃。“美联储根据其作为国家中央银行的职责，今天确认其准备好支持经济和金融体系。” 16这种简洁不是代表机智的灵魂，而是代表不确定性的灵魂。格林斯潘不知道还能做什么，市场可能已经感觉到了这一点，因为它继续崩溃。然后在下午 1 点左右，一些不知名的投资者开始买回股票，市场开始了其历史上最大的反弹。罗伯特·伍德沃德在他的格林斯潘传记《大师》（Maestro）中指出 ：“几个人或公司可能协同操作以操纵市场。” 17如果是这样，没有人想知道。本着 J.P. 摩根的精神，这个阴谋集团很可能已经拯救了经济。

As they say, “success has a thousand fathers,” and with order restored in the capital markets, Greenspan emerged as patriarch-in-chief. Still, Black Monday had left him feeling as adrift as Dave had upon realizing that Hal was the one running the spaceship in the film2001: A Space Odyssey. “I know I’ve made some very poor decisions recently, but I can give you my complete assurance that my work will be back to normal,” Hal told Dave after killing his copilot.

正如人们所说的，“成功有一千个父亲”，随着资本市场秩序的恢复，格林斯潘成为了总负责人。但是，“黑色星期一” 还是让他感到漂泊不定，就像戴夫意识到电影《2001 年：太空漫游》中的哈尔是掌管宇宙飞船的人一样。“我知道我最近做了一些非常糟糕的决定，但我可以向你完全保证，我的工作将恢复正常”，哈尔在杀死他的副驾驶后告诉戴夫。

“I’ve still got the greatest enthusiasm and confidence in the mission. And I want to help you.” 18When the quants said much the same to Wall Street after October 19, their bosses had little choice but to listen.

“我对这项任务仍有最大的热情和信心。我真的是想帮你。” 1810 月 19 日之后，当量化师们对华尔街说了同样的话时，他们的老板们除了听之外没有什么选择。

Although nominally Republican, Greenspan sloughed off administration pressure and pushed through a series of rate hikes that triggered a shallow recession and cost George H. W. Bush reelection in 1992. Upon taking office in 1993, Bill Clinton was warned about Greenspan. “Look what he did to Bush,” his advisors told him. “He’s going to do it to you.” 19Chief economic advisor and former cochair of Goldman Sachs Robert Rubin knew better. He counseled Clinton that if he were serious about the economy, controlling long-term interest rates was essential. “You mean to tell me that the success of the program and my reelection hinges on the Federal Reserve and a bunch of fing bond traders?” 20Clinton asked. The answer was yes. Greenspan was running the show, and by decade’s end the media was treating him like a rock star.

尽管格林斯潘名义上是共和党人，但他摆脱了政府的压力，推动了一系列的加息，引发了浅层次的经济衰退，使乔治·H·W·布什在 1992 年失去了连任。1993 年上任后，比尔·克林顿对格林斯潘提出警告。“看看他对布什做了什么”，他的顾问告诉他，“他会对你做同样的事情。” 19首席经济顾问、高盛集团前联合主席罗伯特·鲁宾知道得更清楚。他劝告克林顿，如果他认真对待经济，控制长期利率是至关重要的。“你的意思是告诉我，该计划的成功和我的连任取决于美联储和一群该死的债券交易员？” 20克林顿问。答案是肯定的。格林斯潘正在主持大局，到十年结束时，媒体把他当成了摇滚明星。

Bond traders, however, only get one vote each, and to get reelected after a rocky start, Clinton knew he would have to win over his liberal base. As early as 1993, HUD began to bring legal action against those mortgage bankers who declined a higher percentage of minorities than whites. In 1995, the Clinton administration put teeth in Jimmy Carter’s 1977 Community Reinvestment Act (CRA), which had merely “encouraged” financial institutions to “help meet the credit needs of local communities.” 21Under Clinton, regulators moved from encouraging to strong-arming.

然而，债券交易商每人只有一票，为了在坎坷的开局之后获得连任，克林顿知道他必须赢得他的自由派基础。早在 1993 年，住房和城乡建设部就开始对那些拒绝少数民族比例高于白人的抵押贷款银行家提起法律诉讼。1995 年，克林顿政府为吉米·卡特 1977 年的《社区再投资法案》（CRA）加上了牙齿，该法案只是 “鼓励” 金融机构 “帮助满足当地社区的信贷需求”。21在克林顿领导下，监管机构从鼓励转向强硬。

The regulators were backed by the street-level bullyboy tactics of ACORN, shorthand for Association of Community Organizations for Reform Now. Founded in 1970 as an offshoot of the welfare rights movement, this mischievous left-wing syndicate turned its attention to housing in the 1990s and proved remarkably effective in a dysfunctional kind of way.

监管机构得到了 ACORN（Association of Community Organizations for Reform Now 的简称）的街头霸王策略的支持。这个顽皮的左翼集团成立于 1970 年，是福利权利运动的一个分支，在 20 世纪 90 年代将其注意力转向住房问题，并以一种功能紊乱的方式证明了其显著的有效性。

Even before Clinton was elected, ACORN had begun to lobby for a strengthening of the CRA. In 1991, its operatives set the stage for their new focus with a two-day takeover of the House Banking Committee hearing room. Historically, banks had been reluctant to offer home loans to people who might not pay them back, and so ACORN set out to embarrass bankers into overcoming that reluctance. “If there was no community pressure and the law, few banks would do something,” 22ACORN’s housing director Michael Shea told theNew York Timesin 1992.

甚至在克林顿当选之前，ACORN 已经开始为加强 CRA 进行游说。1991 年，该组织的工作人员通过两天时间接管众议院银行委员会的听证室，为他们的新焦点创造了条件。从历史上看，银行一直不愿意向那些可能无法偿还的人提供住房贷款，因此 ACORN 开始让银行家们感到尴尬，以克服这种不情愿。“如果没有社区的压力和法律，很少有银行会采取行动”，22ACORN 的住房主任迈克尔·谢伊（Michael Shea）在 1992 年如此对《纽约时报》说。

A sympathetic media romanticized ACORN and turned what might have been a nuisance for the banks into a public relations nightmare. As theTimesreported approvingly, “The nation’s largest banks have come to the negotiating table just to silence objections that could derail or create costly delays to a merger.” 23TheTimescited a federal regulator who seemed equally at ease with ACORN’s soft-core extortion: “Acorn is street-tough and they bedevil the bankers. But they’ve gotten banks to commit millions they otherwise would not have lent.” 24When the CRA grew fangs, ACORN bit harder. Its enforcers harassed lenders and contested their plans to expand into new branches or new states unless they could show that they were “CRA-compliant.” ACORN also lobbied a reluctant Fannie Mae to buy the loans that it had pressured the banks into making.

有同情心的媒体将 ACORN 浪漫化，并将原本对银行来说可能是个麻烦的事情变成了公共关系的噩梦。正如《泰晤士报》赞许地报道的那样，“美国最大的银行来到谈判桌前，只是为了压制反对意见，这些反对意见可能会破坏合并或造成昂贵的延误。” 23《时报》引用了一位联邦监管机构，他似乎对 ACORN 的软核心敲诈同样放心不下。他说 ：“ACORN 是街头的强硬派，他们让银行家们烦恼不已。但他们已经让银行承诺了数百万的贷款，否则他们不会贷款。” 24当 CRA 长出獠牙时，ACORN 咬得更紧。它的执法者骚扰贷款人，并质疑他们扩展到新的分支机构或新的州的计划，除非他们能证明他们是 “符合 CRA 要求的”。ACORN 还游说不情愿的房利美购买它迫使银行发放的贷款。

To make ACORN’s task easier, the Clinton administration demanded that banks quantify the progress they were making in giving loans to LMIs — people of low and moderate income. The administration encouraged banks to use “innovative or flexible” lending practices to reach their LMI numbers. Meanwhile HUD, which Congress had made the regulator of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac in 1992, began to pressure these agencies to set numerical goals for affordable housing, even if that meant buying subprime mortgages. Angelo Mozilo’s Countrywide Financial was happy to help. In July 1999, the company announced a strategic agreement with Fannie Mae, promising to allocate “a substantial portion of Countrywide’s agency-eligible production to Fannie Mae.” 25

为了使 ACORN 的任务更容易完成，克林顿政府要求银行量化他们在向 LMIs —— 中低收入者提供贷款方面所取得的进展。政府鼓励银行使用 “创新或灵活” 的贷款做法，以达到其 LMI 人数。同时，国会在 1992 年让房利美和房地美的监管机构 —— 住房和城市发展部开始向这些机构施压，要求它们为可负担住房设定数字目标，即使这意味着购买次级抵押贷款。安吉洛·莫齐洛的全国金融公司很乐意帮忙。1999 年 7 月，该公司宣布与房利美达成战略协议，承诺将 “全国范围内符合机构资格的大部分产品分配给房利美”。25

A September 1999New York Timesarticle offers a useful window on the pressures that were being brought to bear on the lending industry. The article blithely cheers on the work of Fannie Mae, then in the process of prodding banks to provide mortgages to those whose credit was “not good enough to qualify for conventional loans.” 26The article leaves the oddball impression that the lenders begged to be prodded. Banks, theTimestells us, were “pressing Fannie Mae to help them make more loans to so-called subprime borrowers.” 27The banks, in fact, were responding to the pressure from Washington.

1999 年 9 月《纽约时报》的一篇文章提供了一个有用的窗口，让人们了解贷款行业所面临的压力。这篇文章轻描淡写地对房利美的工作表示赞赏，当时房利美正在推动银行向那些信用 “不够好、法获得常规贷款的人” 提供抵押贷款。26这篇文章给人留下了奇怪的印象，即贷款人恳求被催促。《泰晤士报》告诉我们，银行正在 “向房利美施压，以帮助他们向所谓的次级借款人提供更多的贷款。” 27事实上，这些银行正在回应来自华盛顿的压力。

With a gun to their head, the lenders turned to Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to relieve them of the imprudent loans they were now being forced to make. Before the 1990s, Fannie and Freddie had sufficiently tough lending standards that default was not much of an issue. That would change. In 1999, the newly appointed CEO, Franklin Delano Raines, was boasting of the changes Fannie Mae had already made and the changes to come. As he told theTimes, Fannie Mae had lowered the down payment requirements for a home and now planned to extend credit to borrowers a “notch below” 28its traditional standards. That notch was spelledsubprime.

在被枪指着脑袋的情况下，贷款人转向房利美和房地美，以解除他们现在被迫提供的不谨慎的贷款。在二十世纪 90 年代之前，房利美和房地美有足够严格的贷款标准，违约并不是什么问题。这种情况将会改变。1999 年，新任命的首席执行官富兰克林·德拉诺·雷恩斯(Franklin Delano Raines)正在吹嘘房利美已经做出的改变和即将发生的变化。他告诉《泰晤士报》，房利美已经降低了房屋的首付要求，现在计划向借款人提供 “低于” 28其传统标准的贷款。这个缺口被拼成了 “次贷” （subprime）。

Few words in recent media history have been bandied about with less comprehension thansubprime. Typically, reporters use subprime as an adjective to describe a kind of loan when it would be more accurately used to describe a kind of borrower. In the way of background, engineer Bill Fair and mathematician Earl Isaac started a business in 1956 called the Fair Isaac Corporation, whose mission was to measure credit risk. They came up with a model they called FICO, which is now the most widely used credit-scoring system in the world.29The system is based on the sensible premise that the best way to judge a would-be borrower’s ability to handle credit is to assess how he or she handled it in the past. Lenders consider a borrower with a FICO score in the 650 to 850 a prime credit prospect. Those who score beneath 650 are considered subprime. Historically at least, lenders solicited prime prospects. Subprime prospects solicited lenders. As supplicants, subprime borrowers have had a limited ability to shop for better rates.

在最近的媒体历史上，很少有比 “次贷” 更容易被理解的词汇被戏弄。通常情况下，记者用次贷作为形容词来描述一种贷款，而它更准确地用于描述一种借款人。在背景方面，工程师比尔·费尔和数学家厄尔·艾萨克在 1956 年创办了一家名为费尔·艾萨克公司的企业，其任务是衡量信用风险。他们想出了一个叫做 FICO 的模型，现在是世界上最广泛使用的信用评分系统。29该系统基于一个合理的前提，即判断一个潜在借款人处理信贷能力的最佳方式是评估他或她过去如何处理信贷。贷款人认为 FICO 分数在 650 至 850 之间的借款人是最佳的信贷前景。那些得分低于 650 分的人被认为是次优的。至少在历史上，贷款人招揽优质潜在客户。次级贷款人则向贷款人索取。作为请求者，次级借款人在选择更好的利率方面能力有限。

Given the greater risk, and their inability to shop, subprime prospects typically have had to pay more interest to secure a loan. Adam Michelson makes the salient point in his critical look at Countrywide’s unraveling,The Foreclosure of America, that higher rates do not bespeak an “evil conspiracy.” Says Michelson, a former Countrywide executive, “If corporations were not additionally compensated for the additional risk they were assuming by underwriting these Subprime loans, the marketplace would cease lending to those with less than perfect credit.” 30Wanting it both ways, ACORN and its fellow travelers would denounce the higher rates for subprime borrowers as “predatory lending.”

考虑到更大的风险，他们也确实无法选择，次级贷款的前景通常不得不支付更多的利息来保证贷款。亚当·迈克尔森在他对全国范围内的解体的批评中提出了一个突出的观点 ：“美国的止赎”，较高的利率并不意味着 “邪恶的阴谋”。他说 ：“如果公司不为他们通过承保这些次级贷款而承担的额外风险提供额外的补偿，市场就会停止向那些信用不够好的人贷款。” 30如果想两全其美，ACORN 和它的同路人会谴责次级贷款者的高利率是 “掠夺性贷款”。

For investors, high interest translated into high yield. In October 1997, almost ten years to the day after Black Monday, the investment banks Bear Stearns and First Union Capital Markets underwrote the first securitization of subprime loans for a total of $385 million. The triple-A rating of Freddie Mac–approved loans seemed, at least, to guarantee the payments on these securities. The back-patting press release announcing the launch hit all the bubble-era hot buttons: these “affordable” and “flexible” mortgages offered the possibility of credit for “low and moderate income families” in “traditionally underserved markets.” 31

对投资者来说，高利息转化为高收益。1997 年 10 月，在 “黑色星期一” 之后的近十年时间里，投资银行贝尔斯登和第一联合资本市场为第一笔次贷证券化提供了总额为 3.85 亿美元的担保。房地美 —— 批准的贷款的 AAA 评级似乎至少可以保证这些证券的付款。宣布推出该证券的新闻发布会上，所有泡沫时代的热门话题都被提及：这些 “负担得起” 和 “灵活” 的抵押贷款为 “传统上服务不足的市场” 中的 “中低收入家庭” 提供了信贷的可能性。

These securities proved enormously popular. They promised a 7.5 percent yield in a low-interest environment and, if that were not enough, a chance to cleanse one’s venal Wall Street soul by doing what appeared to be a social good. “At the time I bought the subprime portfolio,” writes Michael Lewis, here in the satiric guise of a busted hedge fund manager, “I thought: This is sort of like my way of giving something back.” 32

这些证券被证明非常受欢迎。它们承诺在低利率环境下有 7.5% 的收益率，如果这还不够的话，还有机会通过做看似社会公益的事情来净化自己邪恶的华尔街灵魂。“在我购买次贷组合的时候”，迈克尔·刘易斯写道，他在这里以一个破产的对冲基金经理的身份进行讽刺，“我想，这有点像我回馈社会的方式。” "32

Bear Stearns would live to regret its involvement in the subprime business, but then again, the company had built its reputation on risk taking and innovation. Founded in 1923, the firm first got serious about bonds in general in 1933, when partner Teddy Low (born Theodore Lowenstein) recommended that the firm hire a hulking twenty-four-year-old former pro-football player named Salim “Cy” Lewis.33The son of Jewish immigrants from eastern Europe, Lewis was charged with investing the firm’s own capital in corporate bonds. Lewis’s main chance came with Roosevelt’s seizure of the railroads during World War II.

贝尔·斯登（Bear Stearns）会对其参与次贷业务感到后悔，但话说回来，该公司的声誉是建立在冒险和创新上的。该公司成立于 1923 年，1933 年，当合伙人泰迪·洛（生于西奥多·洛文斯坦）建议公司雇用一个名叫萨利姆·赛·刘易斯的 24 岁前职业足球运动员时，公司首次认真对待一般的债券。 33刘易斯是来自东欧的犹太移民的儿子，负责将公司的自有资金投资于公司债券。刘易斯的主要机会来自于二战期间罗斯福对铁路的夺取。

Although railroad bonds remained in play during the war, no one wanted to buy them. The reason was simple: they paid no interest. When Lewis saw that the bonds were selling for as little as 5 cents on the dollar, he bet on the home team to win the war and started snatching them up. At war’s end, these bonds rose to par, and Bear Stearns pocketed the difference. No longer content to make money as mere agent on investor transactions, Bear Stearns now looked for ways to make money with its own money. The private equity era on Wall Street was about to kick into gear.

尽管铁路债券在战争期间仍在发挥作用，但没有人愿意购买它们。原因很简单：它们不付利息。当刘易斯看到这些债券的售价只有一美元 5 美分时，他把赌注押在主队赢得战争上，开始抢购这些债券。在战争结束时，这些债券涨到了面值，而贝尔斯登则将差价收入囊中。贝尔斯登不再满足于仅仅作为投资者交易的代理人赚钱，现在他寻找用自己的钱赚钱的方法。华尔街的私募股权时代即将启动。

In 1949, Lewis hired the man who would become his successor, another tough, athletic Jew named Theodore “Ace” Greenberg.34As befit the firm’s image, Greenberg slighted MBAs in favor of candidates with a PSD degree — poor, smart, and with a deep desire to become rich. To jumpstart its humble “mortgage related securities department” 35in 1983, Bear Stearns hired PSD Tommy Marano, who in turn hired a controversial but highly effective Lewie Ranieri alum from Salomon Brothers named Howie Rubin. By 1989, Bear Stearns had blown by Salomon Brothers and emerged as the market leader in mortgage securities. The firm surprised no one on Wall Street when it pioneered the subprime market in 1997. The timing seemed good. The year before, 1996, home ownership had crossed the 65 percent mark for the first time since 1981.

1949 年，刘易斯雇用了将成为他的继任者的人，另一个名叫西奥多· “王牌” ·格林伯格的强硬、运动型犹太人。 34为了符合公司的形象，格林伯格对 MBA 不屑一顾，而对拥有 PSD 学位的候选人则青睐有加；贫穷、聪明，而且对致富有着强烈的渴望。为了启动其简陋的 “抵押贷款相关证券部门” 35在 1983 年，贝尔斯登雇用了 PSD 汤米·马拉诺，后者又从所罗门兄弟公司雇用了一位有争议但非常有效的路易·拉涅利校友，名叫豪伊·卢宾。到 1989 年，贝尔斯登已经击败所罗门兄弟公司，成为抵押贷款证券市场的领导者。该公司在 1997 年开创了次贷市场，这让华尔街没有人感到惊讶。时机似乎不错。前一年，即 1996 年，房屋所有权自 1981 年以来首次突破 65% 的大关。

A second Greenberg comes into play here: Maurice “Hank” Greenberg, a cousin of Ace.36A World War II vet who had participated in the liberation of Dachau, Greenberg was handed the reins of the flailing American International Group (AIG) in 1968 and built it into the world’s largest and most prosperous insurance company. It was in 1998 that AIG’s Financial Product unit (AIGFP) entered the market for credit default swaps, which had been created by the bankers at J. P. Morgan. The bankers had been looking for an AAA-rated nonbank to insure the debt of public corporations and AIG took the bait. Hugely profitable, credit default swaps helped make AIGFP the most productive of all the insurance giant’s divisions.

第二个格林伯格在这里开始发挥作用。36格林伯格是一名二战老兵，曾参加过解放达豪的行动，1968 年，他被派去掌管陷入困境的美国国际集团（AIG），并将其打造成为全球最大、最繁荣的保险企业。1998 年，AIG 的金融产品部门（AIGFP）进入了信用违约掉期市场，该市场是由摩根公司的银行家们创建的。银行家们一直在寻找一个 AAA 级的非银行机构来为公共公司的债务提供保险，AIG 上钩了。信用违约掉期利润巨大，使 AIGFP 成为保险业巨头所有部门中生产力最高的部门。

In his valedictory address at the Democratic National Convention in August 2000, President Clinton celebrated “the highest home ownership rate in our history.” At the time, the figure had moved beyond 67 percent and was still rising. Not shy about his presumed accomplishments, the president thanked the conventioneers for supporting his agenda, one that “has taken our country to new heights of prosperity, progress, and peace.”

在 2000 年 8 月民主党全国代表大会的告别演说中，克林顿总统庆祝 “我们历史上最高的住房拥有率”。当时，这个数字已经超过了 67%，而且还在不断上升。总统并不讳言他所取得的成就，他感谢大会成员支持他的议程，这个议程 “将我们的国家带到了繁荣、进步与和平的新高度。”

To rally the base a week before the 2000 election, the Clinton administration announced historic new regulations that would put a further squeeze on Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac. “These new regulations will greatly enhance access to affordable housing for minorities, urban residents, new immigrants and others left behind, giving millions of families the opportunity to buy homes,” said HUD secretary Andrew Cuomo. “We acknowledge and appreciate that Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac have accepted this challenge.” 37

在 2000 年大选前一周，为了凝聚民心，克林顿政府宣布了历史性的新法规，将进一步挤压房利美和房地美。“这些新规定将大大增加少数民族、城市居民、新移民和其他被遗弃者获得可负担住房的机会，使数百万家庭有机会购买住房”，住房和城市发展部部长安德鲁·科莫说。“我们承认并感谢房利美和房地美接受了这一挑战。” 37

The regs upped Fannie and Freddie’s “affordable housing” quota from 42 to 50 percent. If the political hacks running these allegedly private enterprises protested this new challenge, it did not make the news. In fact, they seemed proud to pioneer this brave new frontier. “We have not been a major presence in the subprime market,” said Fannie CEO Raines, “but you can bet that under these goals, we will be.” Fannie’s CFO, Timothy Howard, added that “making loans to people with less-than-perfect credit” is “something we should do.” 38

该条例将房利和房地的 “可负担住房” 配额从 42% 提高到 50%。如果经营这些所谓的私营企业的政治黑客对这一新的挑战提出抗议，那也没有成为新闻。事实上，他们似乎对开创这个勇敢的新领域感到自豪。房利公司首席执行官雷恩斯说 ：“我们在次贷市场上并不是一个主要的存在，但你可以打赌，在这些目标下，我们将成为主要的存在。” 房利的首席财务官蒂莫西·霍华德补充说，“向信用不够完美的人提供贷款是我们应该做的事情”。 38
